translated: then how can the experience of the mind be uncertain?

original: de'i phyir 'dis ni rtog pa dang bcas par smra bas gsal ba la rang nyams su myong ba med par bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis ni rtog pa dang bcas par smra bas gsal ba la rang nyams su myong ba med par bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, this shows that the proponent of the existence of conceptions has no experience of the mind.

original: 'on te gzugs kyi blo'i nyams su myong ba rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs kyi blo'i nyams su myong ba rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid de /
translated: But if the experience of the mind that perceives form is accompanied by conceptions,

original: blo yod pa'o snyam du phyis nges pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: blo yod pa'o snyam du phyis nges pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: then it is the mind that is later ascertained to exist.üîΩIn response, it is said:

original: smras pa / de nyid kyis myong ma yin na //
analyzed: smras pa / de nyid kyis myong ma yin na //
translated: It is not experienced by that itself.

original: rtog gnyis cig car mthong ba med ;üîΩ/ ces bya ba la /
analyzed: rtog gnyis cig car mthong ba med ; / ces bya ba la /
translated: Two conceptions do not simultaneously see.

original: gzugs kyi blo'i myong ba ni blo de nyid kyis yin nam /
analyzed: gzugs kyi blo'i myong ba ni blo de nyid kyis yin nam /
translated: Here, is the experience of the mind that perceives form by that mind itself?

original: blo gzhan gyis yin zhes rnam pa gnyis su brtag grang na /
analyzed: blo gzhan gyis yin zhes rnam pa gnyis su brtag grang na /
translated: Or is it by another mind?

original: de la gzugs de nyid kyi blos yin gyi blo nyams su myong bar khas len na ni mthong ba'i rtogs pa dang gzugs kyi rtog pa gnyis cig car skye bar @77a * //üîΩthal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gzugs de nyid kyi blos yin gyi blo nyams su myong bar khas len na ni mthong ba'i rtogs pa dang gzugs kyi rtog pa gnyis cig car skye bar @77a * // thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If you accept that the mind experiences the form itself, then it follows, absurdly, that the realization of seeing and the realization of form arise simultaneously.

original: rtog pa gnyis cig car mthong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa gnyis cig car mthong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: This is because two realizations do not arise simultaneously.

original: 'on te gzugs mthong ba nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo dang / gzugs rim gyis mthong bar 'dod na ni /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs mthong ba nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo dang / gzugs rim gyis mthong bar 'dod na ni /
translated: If you accept that the seeing of form and the seeing of the form's own nature are sequential,

original: gal te mthong ba gcig yin na ji ltar rim pa mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba gcig yin na ji ltar rim pa mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: then how can you say that the seeing is unitary?

original: 'di ltar rim pa yang blo las tha mi dad pas rim pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rim pa yang blo las tha mi dad pas rim pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: This is because the sequence is not different from the mind, and so the sequence itself would not exist.

original: 'on te rim pa yang rim par blo yis mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rim pa yang rim par blo yis mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: If you say that the sequence is seen by the mind in a sequential manner,

original: 'o na ni thug pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni thug pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: then there would be an infinite regress,

original: 'di ltar rim pa yang rim pa gang gis mthong ba de yang blo las tha mi dad pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar rim pa yang rim pa gang gis mthong ba de yang blo las tha mi dad pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: because the sequence by which the sequence is seen is not different from the mind,

original: rim pa med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rim pa med par 'gyur la /
translated: and so the sequence would not exist.

original: de la yang rim pa mthong ba gzhan bstan dgos par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang rim pa mthong ba gzhan bstan dgos par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would follow that it would be necessary to teach other levels of seeing.

original: gzhan yang mngon par zhen pa nyid blo yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon par zhen pa nyid blo yin la /
translated: Moreover, the mind is itself the act of conceiving.

original: mngon par zhen pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the act of conceiving is itself the nature of the mind,

original: blo tha dad pa'o snyam pa yang tha dad pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: blo tha dad pa'o snyam pa yang tha dad pa med pa yin te /
translated: the mind is not different from the act of conceiving.

original: des blo gcig la rim pa ci zhig yod //
analyzed: des blo gcig la rim pa ci zhig yod //
translated: What level of the mind is there in a single mind?

original: 'on te mngon par zhen pa tha dad la /
analyzed: 'on te mngon par zhen pa tha dad la /
translated: If you say that the act of conceiving is different from the mind,

original: zhen par gyur pa ni tha dad pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: zhen par gyur pa ni tha dad pa med do zhe na /
translated: then the conceiver is not different from the mind.

original: mngon par zhen pa de yang rang gi ngo bo nyid mngon par zhen pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa de yang rang gi ngo bo nyid mngon par zhen pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is not the act of conceiving itself the nature of the mind?

original: nyams su myong ba gzhan gyis myong bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba gzhan gyis myong bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the experience of the mind is to be experienced by another mind,

original: de nyid thugs pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid thugs pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: the mind would be without consciousness.

original: 'o na gzugs mthong ba gzhan gyis myong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gzugs mthong ba gzhan gyis myong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If you say that the seeing of form is not experienced by another,

original: phyogs de la yang ci dus mtshungs par gyur pa'i shes pa gzhan gyis gzugs kyi blo myong ba yin nam /
analyzed: phyogs de la yang ci dus mtshungs par gyur pa'i shes pa gzhan gyis gzugs kyi blo myong ba yin nam /
translated: then in that case, is the experience of the mind of form by another consciousness simultaneous with it?

original: 'on te dus tha dad par gyur pas yin zhes phyogs gnyis su brtag grang na /
analyzed: 'on te dus tha dad par gyur pas yin zhes phyogs gnyis su brtag grang na /
translated: But if you imagine that it is due to their being in different times,

original: de la phyogs dang po la 'di smras pa /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po la 'di smras pa /
translated: then in response to the first position, it is said:

original: de ni dus mtshungs can shes pa //
analyzed: de ni dus mtshungs can shes pa //
translated: That is explained as being a consciousness that is simultaneous with it,

original: gzhan gyis myong med bshad pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /üîΩdes ni ste ;üîΩrtog gnyis cig car mthong ba med //
analyzed: gzhan gyis myong med bshad pa yin // zhes bya ba la / des ni ste ; rtog gnyis cig car mthong ba med //
translated: but not experienced by another.üîΩHere, ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the consciousness that is simultaneous with the cognition of form.

original: ces bya ba 'dis gzugs kyi blo dang dus mtshungs pa gang la yod pa'i shes pa gzhan des gzugs kyi blo nyams su myong ba yang bshad pa ste gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'dis gzugs kyi blo dang dus mtshungs pa gang la yod pa'i shes pa gzhan des gzugs kyi blo nyams su myong ba yang bshad pa ste gsal ba yin no //
translated: The other consciousness that exists is explained, that is, it is clear, that it experiences the cognition of form.

original: dus mtshungs pa can gyi shes pa gzhan gyis myong yang rtog pa gnyis cig car skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba so na 'dug go //
analyzed: dus mtshungs pa can gyi shes pa gzhan gyis myong yang rtog pa gnyis cig car skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba so na 'dug go //
translated: Even if it is experienced by another consciousness that is simultaneous with it, the consequence that two thoughts arise simultaneously remains.

original: gzugs kyi blo'i yul can gyi shes pa la yang rtog pa gzhan gyis myong bar bya ba'i phyir rtog pa'i phreng ba ring por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi blo'i yul can gyi shes pa la yang rtog pa gzhan gyis myong bar bya ba'i phyir rtog pa'i phreng ba ring por 'gyur ro //
translated: And because the consciousness that is the subject of the cognition of form is also to be experienced by another thought, there would be a long chain of thoughts.

original: 'on te dus phyis 'byung ba'i shes pa gzhan gyi gzugs kyi blo myong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / 'das pa @77b de ni dran 'gyur na //
analyzed: 'on te dus phyis 'byung ba'i shes pa gzhan gyi gzugs kyi blo myong bar 'gyur ro zhe na / smras pa / 'das pa @77b de ni dran 'gyur na //
translated: then how could that past form be remembered?

original: de ma bzung ba ji ltar 'gyur //üîΩtha dad med can rang blo dang // gzhan blo yongs gcod mtshungs par 'gyur //
analyzed: de ma bzung ba ji ltar 'gyur // tha dad med can rang blo dang // gzhan blo yongs gcod mtshungs par 'gyur //
translated: If it is not apprehended, how could it be remembered?

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩrjes la thob pa'i dus su 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes pa ni 'das pa'i gzugs dran par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / rjes la thob pa'i dus su 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes pa ni 'das pa'i gzugs dran par 'gyur gyi /
translated: And the cognition of self and the cognition of other would be the same in terms of determination.

original: mngon sum ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum ni ma yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat occurs later‚Äù means that the form of the past is remembered, but it is not directly perceived.

original: de'i yul nye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul nye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because its object is not present.

original: 'on te shes pa gzhan gyi dus na gzugs kyi blo yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa gzhan gyi dus na gzugs kyi blo yod do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the cognition of form exists at the time of another cognition,

original: 'o na ni gzugs su snang ba dang bral ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na ni gzugs su snang ba dang bral ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: then it would not be free from the appearance of form.

original: de nyid rtog pa gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid rtog pa gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it follows that it would be a dual cognition.

original: 'on te 'das pa'i gzugs mthong ba la shes pa gzhan 'jug pa de dran pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'das pa'i gzugs mthong ba la shes pa gzhan 'jug pa de dran pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the cognition that occurs in the perception of past form is memory,üîΩthen how could it be memory?

original: dran pa des sngar gyi gzugs ma mthong ba ji ltar dran pas 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: dran pa des sngar gyi gzugs ma mthong ba ji ltar dran pas 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: How could memory of the form that was previously seen apprehend it?

original: de'i phyir gzugs kyi blo 'dzin pa'i nus pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //üîΩ'on te mngon sum gyi don gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs kyi blo 'dzin pa'i nus pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ba yin no // 'on te mngon sum gyi don gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the cognition of form would not have the capacity to apprehend it.

original: gzugs mthong bar skye'o snyam du shes so zhe na /üîΩde lta na ni skyes bu gzhan gyi blo de yongs su gcod pa de dang tha mi dad pa gang la yod pa'i rang gi rgyud kyi blo rtogs pa de ni rang gi blo 'dzin pa can te /
analyzed: gzugs mthong bar skye'o snyam du shes so zhe na / de lta na ni skyes bu gzhan gyi blo de yongs su gcod pa de dang tha mi dad pa gang la yod pa'i rang gi rgyud kyi blo rtogs pa de ni rang gi blo 'dzin pa can te /
translated: But if you think that the cognition of form arises from the form that is the object of direct perception because it is not tenable that the object of direct perception is different,üîΩthen the cognition that is the object of the cognition of form would not be the cognition that apprehends itself.

original: rang ste bdag nyid kyi blo de 'dzin par byed pa'i blo yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang ste bdag nyid kyi blo de 'dzin par byed pa'i blo yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The cognition that is the object of the cognition of form would not be the cognition that apprehends itself, that is, the cognition of form.

original: des ni 'di skad du ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des ni 'di skad du ston par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what it demonstrates.

original: mngon sum gyis don skye bo thams cad kyi thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis don skye bo thams cad kyi thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object of direct perception is common to all beings.

original: rang gi blo'i sgrub byed ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi blo'i sgrub byed ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not the object of one‚Äôs own cognition.

original: 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid du snang ba lkog tu gyur pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid du snang ba lkog tu gyur pa yin pas /
translated: Because the past is a hidden object that appears as an entity,

original: rgyud gzhan gyi shes pa yongs su gcod pa las bye brag med pa nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan gyi shes pa yongs su gcod pa las bye brag med pa nyid du brjod do //
translated: it is said to be no different from the cognition of another continuum.

original: gal te rang rig pas mngon du snang ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te rang rig pas mngon du snang ba yin la /
translated: If the past is a manifest object of reflexive awareness,

original: gzhan rig pa ni mngon du snang ba ma yin na /
analyzed: gzhan rig pa ni mngon du snang ba ma yin na /
translated: but not a manifest object of other awarenesses,

original: de'i tshe rang dang gzhan rig pa tha dad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rang dang gzhan rig pa tha dad par 'gyur te /
translated: then the awareness of self and other would be different.

original: rang rig pas mngon du byed pa ni 'das pa nyid ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rang rig pas mngon du byed pa ni 'das pa nyid ma yin pa ste /
translated: The object of reflexive awareness is not past,

original: mngon du snang bar gyur pa ni da ltar byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon du snang bar gyur pa ni da ltar byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a manifest object is present.

original: de lta ma yin na 'das pa'i shes pa dbang po las 'das pa ni dran pas shes par bya ba kho na ste /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'das pa'i shes pa dbang po las 'das pa ni dran pas shes par bya ba kho na ste /
translated: Otherwise, the past cognition that is beyond the senses would be known only through memory.

original: 'di ltar dran pas gzhag pa'i rnam par rig pas 'das pa'i tha snyad 'dogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar dran pas gzhag pa'i rnam par rig pas 'das pa'i tha snyad 'dogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the designation of the past would exist only through the cognition that is posited by memory.

original: des na rang gi blo dang gzhan gyi blo mtshungs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na rang gi blo dang gzhan gyi blo mtshungs pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, one‚Äôs own awareness and the awareness of another would be the same.

original: 'o na lkog tu gyur pa'i rang gi ni bdag nyid dang 'brel pas shes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'o na lkog tu gyur pa'i rang gi ni bdag nyid dang 'brel pas shes pa yin gyi /
translated: But if it is related to one‚Äôs own hidden self, it is knowledge.

original: rjes su dpag pa las ni ma yin la /üîΩgzhan gyi blo yang gzhan dang @78a * //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa las ni ma yin la / gzhan gyi blo yang gzhan dang @78a * //
translated: It is not inference.

original: 'brel pa nyid kyi shes pa yin na /
analyzed: 'brel pa nyid kyi shes pa yin na /
translated: And if the mind of another is knowledge related to another,üîΩwhy is it not knowledge of that other?

original: de nyid kyi phyir ji ltar khyad par med par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ji ltar khyad par med par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is it not knowledge of that other?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: In response to this, Aryadeva says:

original: 'das pa yin na dpe med cing //
analyzed: 'das pa yin na dpe med cing //
translated: If it is past, it has no example.

original: rtags med par ni don rig pa //
analyzed: rtags med par ni don rig pa //
translated: Without a reason, one cannot know the object.

original: de dag gis grub de la ni //
analyzed: de dag gis grub de la ni //
translated: If it is established by them,

original: mngon sum ma yin rtags can min //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin rtags can min // zhes bya ba la /
translated: it is neither direct perception nor inference.

original: rang gi blo mngon du byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rang gi blo mngon du byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not one‚Äôs own mind that is made evident.

original: mngon sum sngon du song ba'i rjes su dpag pa rang gi blo'i sgrub byed du 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon sum sngon du song ba'i rjes su dpag pa rang gi blo'i sgrub byed du 'gyur te /
translated: Inference based on what is directly perceived is the proof of one‚Äôs own mind.

original: ci ste yang 'das pa'i don rig pa ni dpes shes pa yin na /üîΩ'das pa rig pa la dpe yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang 'das pa'i don rig pa ni dpes shes pa yin na / 'das pa rig pa la dpe yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If the knowledge of a past object is knowledge by analogy,

original: mngon sum las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then the knowledge of the past has no example because it is beyond direct perception.

original: dpe med pa nyid kyis rtags kyang yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: dpe med pa nyid kyis rtags kyang yod pa ma yin na /
translated: Since it has no example, there is no reason.

original: de mthong ba tshad ma gang gis sgrub cing /
analyzed: de mthong ba tshad ma gang gis sgrub cing /
translated: What valid cognition establishes that?

original: bdag dang 'brel ba can nyid kyang gang gis sgrub par 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag dang 'brel ba can nyid kyang gang gis sgrub par 'gyur /
translated: And by what is it established that it is related to the self?

original: don rig pa de la ni rang dang 'brel pa can du mngon sum 'jug pa can ma yin zhing rjes su dpag pa la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: don rig pa de la ni rang dang 'brel pa can du mngon sum 'jug pa can ma yin zhing rjes su dpag pa la yang ma yin te /
translated: That cognition of the object is not engaged in direct perception as being related to itself, nor is it inferred.

original: gal te mngon sum gyi rig pa'i don yin na 'das pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyi rig pa'i don yin na 'das pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the object of direct perception, it is not past.

original: mngon sum med par yang rtags dang rtags can 'brel pa 'dzin pa med par rang gi blo la rjes su dpog pa yang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon sum med par yang rtags dang rtags can 'brel pa 'dzin pa med par rang gi blo la rjes su dpog pa yang med pa'i phyir /
translated: Without direct perception, there is no apprehension of the connection between the evidence and the property-possessor, and there is no inference in one's mind without that.

original: blo tsam zhig yongs su gcod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: blo tsam zhig yongs su gcod pa yin gyi /
translated: It is merely the mind that determines.

original: bdag dang gzhan 'brel ba can nyid rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan 'brel ba can nyid rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not realize the connection between self and other.

original: rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid can mthong na ni /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid can mthong na ni /
translated: If the nature of self-awareness is seen,

original: gang gi rang rig par snang ba de ni de'i bdag nyid mthong ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi rang rig par snang ba de ni de'i bdag nyid mthong ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: then that which appears as self-awareness is seen as its nature.

original: rang gi blo yongs su gcod par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi blo yongs su gcod par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable for one's mind to determine that.

original: gal te de yi rang ngo bor //
analyzed: gal te de yi rang ngo bor //
translated: If it is the essence of that,üîΩ

original: snang ba can blo de ma thag / gzugs sogs bzhin du 'dzin 'gyur na //
analyzed: snang ba can blo de ma thag / gzugs sogs bzhin du 'dzin 'gyur na //
translated: If the cognition that perceives the form of the objectüîΩGrasps the prior cognition,

original: sngar gyi blo de 'dzin mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /üîΩgal te don mthong ba de'i rang gi ngo bor snang ba de ni de'i rnam pa can nyid de /
analyzed: sngar gyi blo de 'dzin mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba ni / gal te don mthong ba de'i rang gi ngo bor snang ba de ni de'i rnam pa can nyid de /
translated: Then the prior cognition would not grasp the object.

original: gang la de yod pa'i blo de yis gzugs mthong ba'i de ma thag tu gzugs su snang bar 'dzin par 'gyur ro //üîΩdper na gzugs kyi rnam pa can gyi blos gzugs la sogs pa 'das pa 'dzin pa bzhin no zhes khas len par byed na ni /
analyzed: gang la de yod pa'i blo de yis gzugs mthong ba'i de ma thag tu gzugs su snang bar 'dzin par 'gyur ro // dper na gzugs kyi rnam pa can gyi blos gzugs la sogs pa 'das pa 'dzin pa bzhin no zhes khas len par byed na ni /
translated: If you accept that the form of the object that is seen is the appearance of its own entity, then the cognition that has that form would be the cognition that perceives the form.

original: phyogs de la yang blo 'dzin pa'i blo de ni sngar gyi blo gang yin pa don 'dzin pa can de 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyogs de la yang blo 'dzin pa'i blo de ni sngar gyi blo gang yin pa don 'dzin pa can de 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If you accept that the cognition that perceives the form grasps the appearance of the form immediately after it perceives the form, just as the cognition that has the aspect of form grasps the past form, then in that case the cognition that grasps the prior cognition would not grasp the prior cognition that grasps the object.

original: 'di ltar gzugs ni sngar gyi gzugs snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs ni sngar gyi gzugs snang ba ma yin te /
translated: This is because the form that is seen is not the prior appearance of the form.

original: mthong ba la gnas pa'i gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan la gzugs so snyam du @78b shes pa yin la /
analyzed: mthong ba la gnas pa'i gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan la gzugs so snyam du @78b shes pa yin la /
translated: The cognition that thinks ‚ÄúThis is form‚Äù is the reflection of the form that is present in the seeing.

original: shes pa gnas pa'i gzugs brnyan mthong ba la gzugs mthong ba nyid du brjod kyi /
analyzed: shes pa gnas pa'i gzugs brnyan mthong ba la gzugs mthong ba nyid du brjod kyi /
translated: When one sees a reflection of the form in which consciousness is situated, one says that one sees the form,

original: gzugs mngon du byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs mngon du byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but one does not see the form directly.

original: de ltar na mthong ba'i rnam pa can gyi rig pa mthong ba'i rig pa po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na mthong ba'i rnam pa can gyi rig pa mthong ba'i rig pa po ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the cognition that has the aspect of seeing is not the seer that sees,

original: gzugs mthong ba'i rnam pa can gyi rig pa rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs mthong ba'i rnam pa can gyi rig pa rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cognition that has the aspect of seeing the form is nonconceptual.

original: 'on te gzugs su snang ba'i rnam pa can gyi rig pa yang rig par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs su snang ba'i rnam pa can gyi rig pa yang rig par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if the cognition that has the aspect of the appearance of form is cognition,

original: 'o na ni rig pa de yang rig pa gzhan gyis gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na ni rig pa de yang rig pa gzhan gyis gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: then that cognition would be apprehended by another cognition,

original: thug pa med par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'on te gzugs su snang ba'i rnam pa can gyi rig pas mi 'dzin no zhe na /üîΩde lta na ni shes pa gzhan la gnas pa'i gzugs mthong ba mi rigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thug pa med par 'gyur ro // 'on te gzugs su snang ba'i rnam pa can gyi rig pas mi 'dzin no zhe na / de lta na ni shes pa gzhan la gnas pa'i gzugs mthong ba mi rigs pa'i phyir /
translated: and so there would be an infinite regress.üîΩBut if the cognition that has the aspect of the appearance of form does not apprehend it,üîΩthen it is not reasonable that one sees the form in which consciousness is situated,

original: rang rig pas rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang rig pas rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: and so it is not reasonable that there is reflexive awareness.

original: 'o na gal te gzugs su snang ba'i ngo bo nyid rang rig pas yul du byed pa ni rtog pa med par snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na gal te gzugs su snang ba'i ngo bo nyid rang rig pas yul du byed pa ni rtog pa med par snang ba'i phyir /
translated: But if the entity that appears as form is made into an object by autocognition, then since it appears without thought,

original: rang rig pa rtog pa med pa nyid yin yang /
analyzed: rang rig pa rtog pa med pa nyid yin yang /
translated: autocognition is indeed without thought.

original: gzugs la sogs pa tha dad pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa la snang ba la 'gal ba ci zhig yod ce na smras pa /üîΩji ltar rang yul can shes pa //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa tha dad pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa la snang ba la 'gal ba ci zhig yod ce na smras pa / ji ltar rang yul can shes pa //
translated: But what contradiction is there in the appearance of the various forms and so on that are associated with thought?üîΩIt is said:üîΩJust as the experience of the cognition

original: nyams myong de ni rtog med yin //
analyzed: nyams myong de ni rtog med yin //
translated: that has its own object is nonconceptual,

original: de bzhin rnam rtog med gzhan yang //üîΩbrda byas nus pa ma yin phyir //
analyzed: de bzhin rnam rtog med gzhan yang // brda byas nus pa ma yin phyir //
translated: so too is the other that is without thought,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: because it is not able to make a sign.

original: ji ltar rang ste bdag nyid kyi yul gang la yod pa'i shes pa nyams su myong ba de ni mi rtog pa ste /üîΩde bzhin du gzugs 'dzin pa gzhan yang rtog pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar rang ste bdag nyid kyi yul gang la yod pa'i shes pa nyams su myong ba de ni mi rtog pa ste / de bzhin du gzugs 'dzin pa gzhan yang rtog pa med pa yin te /
translated: Just as the experience of the cognition that has its own object is nonconceptual,

original: brdar bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brdar bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: so too is the other that is without thought, the apprehender of form, because it is not able to make a sign.

original: gzugs 'dzin pa gang la brdar bya bar mi nus pa yod pa de de ltar yin no //
analyzed: gzugs 'dzin pa gang la brdar bya bar mi nus pa yod pa de de ltar yin no //
translated: The apprehender of form that is not able to make a sign is just like that.

original: 'di'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning of this is as follows.

original: mthong ba'i rang gi ngo bo nyid myong ba ci'i phyir rtog pa med pa yin zhes brtsad pa'i lan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i rang gi ngo bo nyid myong ba ci'i phyir rtog pa med pa yin zhes brtsad pa'i lan ni 'di yin te /
translated: The reply to the objection, ‚ÄúWhy is the experience of the intrinsic reality of seeing not conceptual?‚Äù is as follows.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid snang bar gyur pa la rang gi ngo bo dang lhan cig sgra sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid snang bar gyur pa la rang gi ngo bo dang lhan cig sgra sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the intrinsic reality that appears is not connected with the intrinsic reality of sound.

original: de lta yin pas phyi rol yang mthong ba la sgra sbyor bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin pas phyi rol yang mthong ba la sgra sbyor bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Since that is the case, external form also cannot be connected with seeing,

original: mngon du snang bar gyur pa la sbyor ba dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon du snang bar gyur pa la sbyor ba dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: because it is free from connection with what appears.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid snang bar gyur pa la sgra'i rnam pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid snang bar gyur pa la sgra'i rnam pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the intrinsic reality of form and so on that appears is not seen in the aspect of sound.

original: de bas na de nyams su myong ba rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na de nyams su myong ba rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: Therefore the experience of that is not conceptual.

original: 'o na gal te gzugs mthong ba'i tshe sgra'i rnam pa gsal bar snang ba ma yin pa de lta na yang sgra'i spyi dran par gyur pa yod de /
analyzed: 'o na gal te gzugs mthong ba'i tshe sgra'i rnam pa gsal bar snang ba ma yin pa de lta na yang sgra'i spyi dran par gyur pa yod de /
translated: But if at the time of seeing form the aspect of sound does not clearly appear, then the universal of sound is recalled.

original: de yis yongs su @79a * //
analyzed: de yis yongs su @79a * //
translated: Because of that,

original: bcad pa'i sngon po la sogs pa shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcad pa'i sngon po la sogs pa shes pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the cognition of the blue that is cut.

original: phyi rol 'dzin pa ci ste rtog pa med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol 'dzin pa ci ste rtog pa med pa yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWhy is the apprehension of external objects not conceptual?‚Äù

original: 'di la rta ru rtog pas ba lang mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya bas lan btab zin to //
analyzed: 'di la rta ru rtog pas ba lang mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya bas lan btab zin to //
translated: The response has already been given: ‚ÄúBecause one sees a cow by conceiving it to be a horse.‚ÄùüîΩMoreover:üîΩThe words that have the mode of not expressing

original: gzhan yang // mi brjod dang tshul can sgra dang // de dang don gcig can rtog pa //
analyzed: gzhan yang // mi brjod dang tshul can sgra dang // de dang don gcig can rtog pa //
translated: and the conception that has the same meaning as that

original: rtog pa med pa med na ni //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa med na ni //
translated: are not nonconceptual.

original: khyad par ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khyad par ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: How would a distinction be cognized?üîΩHere, the words that have the mode of expressing a universal are like that,

original: dpyod pa gang zhig gi spyi brjod pa'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa'i sgra rnams de ni de lta bu dang / sgra dang lhan cig don gcig pa gang la yod pa'i rtog pa de ni de lta bu ste /
analyzed: dpyod pa gang zhig gi spyi brjod pa'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa'i sgra rnams de ni de lta bu dang / sgra dang lhan cig don gcig pa gang la yod pa'i rtog pa de ni de lta bu ste /
translated: and the conception that has the same meaning as that word is like that.

original: rgol ba de yis rtog pa med par snang ba med na /
analyzed: rgol ba de yis rtog pa med par snang ba med na /
translated: If the opponent does not have a nonconceptual appearance,

original: khyad par rtog pa yod par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: khyad par rtog pa yod par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how would a conceptual distinction occur?

original: 'on te sgra dang lhan cig don gcig pa can rtog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te sgra dang lhan cig don gcig pa can rtog pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is said, ‚ÄúThe conception that has the same meaning as the word is not nonconceptual,‚Äù

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: then what is it?

original: khyad par shes pa can rtog pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par shes pa can rtog pa yin no zhe na /
translated: In particular, the cognition of a specific thing is conceptual.

original: de lta na ni sgra yis bcad pa ni khyad par shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na ni sgra yis bcad pa ni khyad par shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If that were so, then the cognition of a specific thing would not be the cognition of a word because

original: 'di ba lang yin no zhes bya ba khyad par mthong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ba lang yin no zhes bya ba khyad par mthong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: the cognition of a specific thing would not see the word cow.

original: sgra sbyor ba'i ngo bo nyid blo yang gzhan yin zhing /
analyzed: sgra sbyor ba'i ngo bo nyid blo yang gzhan yin zhing /
translated: This is because the cognition that is the nature of the combination of words is one thing and

original: khyad par 'dzin pa yang gzhan yin pa'i phyir gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir dang / rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par 'dzin pa yang gzhan yin pa'i phyir gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir dang / rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the apprehension of a specific thing is another, because they are different in being clear and unclear and because they have different causes.

original: 'di ltar sgra'i rnam pa can nyid kyi rgyu bag chags yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra'i rnam pa can nyid kyi rgyu bag chags yin la /
translated: Thus the cause of the aspect of a word is a latent potentiality.

original: gsal ba'i rang bzhin myong ba'i rgyu ni mig yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba'i rang bzhin myong ba'i rgyu ni mig yin te /
translated: The cause of the nature of clarity is the eye.

original: 'di ltar mthong ba ma rtogs par sngar myong bas bzhag pa'i bag chags sad pa nyid sgra'i snang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong ba ma rtogs par sngar myong bas bzhag pa'i bag chags sad pa nyid sgra'i snang ba yin no //
translated: Thus the appearance of a word is the awakening of a latent potentiality that is deposited by a previous experience that is not understood.

original: mig phye ba na rjod par byed pa dran pa'i gtod pa med kyang gzugs mthong ba'i dus su rtog pa skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig phye ba na rjod par byed pa dran pa'i gtod pa med kyang gzugs mthong ba'i dus su rtog pa skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: When the eyes are open, even though there is no recollection that directs the expression, the thought ‚ÄúI see form‚Äù does not arise.

original: 'on te rtog pa mig dang 'brel pa nges pa med na gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid ba lang de nyid 'di yin zhes bya ba gzhi mthun pa'i sgra'i rnam pa can du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rtog pa mig dang 'brel pa nges pa med na gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid ba lang de nyid 'di yin zhes bya ba gzhi mthun pa'i sgra'i rnam pa can du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if the thought associated with the eyes is not ascertained, then the thought ‚ÄúThat very cow is the clear entity‚Äù would not be a thought that has a common locus with the word.

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: mthong ba dang gzhi mthun pa can sgra yis gzhag pa shes pa tsam las mthong ba dang rtog pa dag la rgyu gcig pa can nyid mi 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: mthong ba dang gzhi mthun pa can sgra yis gzhag pa shes pa tsam las mthong ba dang rtog pa dag la rgyu gcig pa can nyid mi 'grub pa ste /
translated: The mere cognition that is posited by the sound that has a common locus with seeing does not establish that seeing and thought have the same cause.

original: rjes su dpag pas shes pa'i me dang mthong bas gzhag pa'i gzugs la ri 'di ni me dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba'i gzhi mthun pa can yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas shes pa'i me dang mthong bas gzhag pa'i gzugs la ri 'di ni me dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba'i gzhi mthun pa can yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is a common locus of the fire that is posited by seeing and the form that is posited by inference, for one can say, ‚ÄúThis mountain has fire.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang sgra'i rnam pa can nyid rtog pa la snang ba yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgra'i rnam pa can nyid rtog pa la snang ba yin la /
translated: Moreover, the aspect of sound appears to thought.

original: mthong ba ni gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
analyzed: mthong ba ni gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
translated: But seeing is a clear entity.

original: de la gzhi mthun pa can gang zhig yod /
analyzed: de la gzhi mthun pa can gang zhig yod /
translated: What is the common locus of those two?

original: 'o na ji ltar gzhi @79b mthun pa'i tha snyad ba lang de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar gzhi @79b mthun pa'i tha snyad ba lang de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: Well then, how could there be the expression ‚Äúthe common locus of those two,‚Äù or ‚Äúthat very cow is this‚Äù?

original: ngo bo gnyis rig pa ni tha dad pa'i rten can gyi dngos po yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ngo bo gnyis rig pa ni tha dad pa'i rten can gyi dngos po yin no zhe na /
translated: The cognition of two natures is a thing that has a different basis.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: don gcig byed pa na gzhi mthun pa can gyi tha snyad yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don gcig byed pa na gzhi mthun pa can gyi tha snyad yin pa'i phyir /
translated: When it performs a single function, it is the expression of a common locus.

original: don dam par ni gzhi mthun pa can med do /
analyzed: don dam par ni gzhi mthun pa can med do /
translated: In the ultimate truth, there is no common locus.

original: 'di ltar de 'di yin no snyam pa'i lkog tu gyur pa dang / da ltar byung bar snang ba can gyi shes pa gnyis kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de 'di yin no snyam pa'i lkog tu gyur pa dang / da ltar byung bar snang ba can gyi shes pa gnyis kho na yin no //
translated: In this way, there are only two cognitions: one that is hidden, thinking ‚ÄúThat is this,‚Äù and one that is manifest, thinking ‚ÄúThis is this.‚Äù

original: gal te rtog med 'ga' zhig kyang //
analyzed: gal te rtog med 'ga' zhig kyang //
translated: If there were any nonconceptual cognition,

original: yod na de dang mtshungs rgyu can //
analyzed: yod na de dang mtshungs rgyu can //
translated: it would have a cause similar to that.

original: thams cad bzhin 'bras tha dad //
analyzed: thams cad bzhin 'bras tha dad //
translated: All effects would be different,

original: rgyu yi tha dad las 'gyur phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu yi tha dad las 'gyur phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: because the cause would be different.

original: 'on te rnam par rtog pa med pa yang dang po 'ga' zhig mthong ba yod pa des khyad par rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rnam par rtog pa med pa yang dang po 'ga' zhig mthong ba yod pa des khyad par rtogs so zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the non-conceptual is the first, and that the difference is understood by the existence of some seeing,

original: de lta na ni rtog pa med pa de dang lhan cig mtshungs pa'i rgyu mig dang don dag shas pa gzhan gang zhig la yod pa de de bzhin du shes pa thams cad rtog pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni rtog pa med pa de dang lhan cig mtshungs pa'i rgyu mig dang don dag shas pa gzhan gang zhig la yod pa de de bzhin du shes pa thams cad rtog pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: then that non-conceptual would be the cause of the eye and the object, and the other consciousnesses would be the same as that non-conceptual.

original: gang gi phyir rgyu tha dad pas 'bras bu rtog pa med pa'i shes pa rnams tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu tha dad pas 'bras bu rtog pa med pa'i shes pa rnams tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the effect, the non-conceptual consciousness, is different due to the difference in causes.

original: de bas na mig la sogs pa las skyes pa thams cad rtog pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de bas na mig la sogs pa las skyes pa thams cad rtog pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, all that arises from the eye and so on is only non-conceptual.

original: 'on te don gyis phan btags pa nyid du rtog pa rig pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te don gyis phan btags pa nyid du rtog pa rig pa yin te /
translated: But if you say that the benefit provided by the object is understood by the conceptual,

original: 'di ba lang yin no snyam pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ba lang yin no snyam pa'o //
translated: thinking ‚ÄúThis is a cow,‚Äù

original: de'i phyir rtog pa dang mthong ba'i rgyu tha dad par grub pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtog pa dang mthong ba'i rgyu tha dad par grub pa med do zhe na /
translated: then the cause of the conceptual and the cause of the seeing are not established as different.

original: smras pa ; brda dran phyir na sbyor ba ni //
analyzed: smras pa ; brda dran phyir na sbyor ba ni //
translated: We say: The application is due to the recollection of the sign,

original: phyi rol don la ltos med can //
analyzed: phyi rol don la ltos med can //
translated: which is independent of external objects.

original: de bzhin brda la ltos med par //üîΩdngos nus nyid kyis mig blor 'gyur //
analyzed: de bzhin brda la ltos med par // dngos nus nyid kyis mig blor 'gyur //
translated: Likewise, without depending on a sign,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The eye consciousness arises from the potential of the object.

original: phyi rol gyi don la ltos pa med pa gang yin pa'i sgra sbyor ba de ni sngar nyams su myong ba'i sgra'i brda dran pa nyid kyi rgyu las 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don la ltos pa med pa gang yin pa'i sgra sbyor ba de ni sngar nyams su myong ba'i sgra'i brda dran pa nyid kyi rgyu las 'byung ba yin la /
translated: The application of the term ‚Äúwithout depending on external objects‚Äù is due to the cause of the recollection of the sign of the sound that was previously experienced.

original: mig gi blo ni sgra'i brda la mi ltos pa nyid du yul du rung ba na gnas pa'i dngos po'i nus pa dang mig gis bskyed pa ste /üîΩde bas na mig gi blo la rtog pa'i rgyu brda dran pa med pa'i phyir sgra'i rnam pa can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mig gi blo ni sgra'i brda la mi ltos pa nyid du yul du rung ba na gnas pa'i dngos po'i nus pa dang mig gis bskyed pa ste / de bas na mig gi blo la rtog pa'i rgyu brda dran pa med pa'i phyir sgra'i rnam pa can ni ma yin te /
translated: The eye consciousness arises from the potential of the object that is present and from the eye, without depending on the sign of the sound.

original: rgyu las 'das nas 'bras bu skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te dbang po dang gzugs kyi //
analyzed: rgyu las 'das nas 'bras bu skye ba med pa'i phyir ro // gal te dbang po dang gzugs kyi //
translated: Therefore, because there is no recollection of the sign that is the cause of conception in the eye consciousness, it does not have the aspect of sound, because the effect does not arise after the cause has ceased.üîΩIf the mind that arises from the eye and form

original: sems ni brda dran la ltos can //
analyzed: sems ni brda dran la ltos can //
translated: Depends on the recollection of the sign,

original: ltos med ma yin rtags bzhin du //üîΩdran pa nyid las nus pa yin //
analyzed: ltos med ma yin rtags bzhin du // dran pa nyid las nus pa yin //
translated: It is not independent, like a smoke-indicator.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is capable due to the recollection itself.

original: 'o na ba lang ngo snyam pa'i rtog pa dang bcas pa dbang po'i sems brda dran pa de la ltos pa can gyi gzugs dang dbang po nus pa can yin gyi /üîΩbrda @80a * //
analyzed: 'o na ba lang ngo snyam pa'i rtog pa dang bcas pa dbang po'i sems brda dran pa de la ltos pa can gyi gzugs dang dbang po nus pa can yin gyi / brda @80a * //
translated: But the form and sense faculty that are related to the mind of the sense faculty that is accompanied by the thought ‚ÄúThis is a cow‚Äù are not related to the memory of the sign.

original: dran pa la ltos pa med par gzugs 'ga' zhig rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa la nus pa yod pa ma yin no zhes khas blang bar bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: dran pa la ltos pa med par gzugs 'ga' zhig rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa la nus pa yod pa ma yin no zhes khas blang bar bya'o zhe na /
translated: You must accept that without relying on the memory of the sign, some form has the ability to produce a conceptual consciousness.

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩrjod par byed pa'i brda dran ba'i ngo bo nyid la nus pa can yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / rjod par byed pa'i brda dran ba'i ngo bo nyid la nus pa can yin gyi /
translated: Here we say:

original: dbang po'i sems la ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i sems la ma yin te /
translated: The form that is related to the memory of the sign that is the means of expression has the ability to produce a conceptual consciousness, but the sense faculty does not.

original: 'di ltar nges pa'i sgra dran pa med na sgra sbyor ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar nges pa'i sgra dran pa med na sgra sbyor ba ma yin zhing /
translated: Because if the memory of the sound that is the sign is not recalled, the sound is not connected.

original: nges pa'i don mthong ba med na yang nges pa'i tshig dran pa skye pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i don mthong ba med na yang nges pa'i tshig dran pa skye pa ma yin no //
translated: And if the meaning of the sign is not seen, the memory of the word that is the sign does not arise.

original: de bas na ba lang mthong ba yod na ba lang gi sgra dran par 'gyur la ba lang gi sgra dran par gyur na yang ba lang ngo snyam du rtog pa skye bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir mthong ba'i rnam pa ni rjod par byed pa dran pa'i rtagsüîΩnyid du rigs te /
analyzed: de bas na ba lang mthong ba yod na ba lang gi sgra dran par 'gyur la ba lang gi sgra dran par gyur na yang ba lang ngo snyam du rtog pa skye bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir mthong ba'i rnam pa ni rjod par byed pa dran pa'i rtags nyid du rigs te /
translated: Therefore, the aspect of perception is the sign of the recollection that expresses the word.

original: de bas na sbyor bas rtogs pa thams cad ni rtags can yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sbyor bas rtogs pa thams cad ni rtags can yin no //
translated: Thus, all understanding through application is inferential.

original: 'on te rigs ma mthong na ji ltar rtags las shes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rigs ma mthong na ji ltar rtags las shes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if the universal is not seen, how can it be known through a sign?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩ

original: yan lag mtshungs pa nyid rigs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag mtshungs pa nyid rigs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the similarity of parts is the universal.

original: yan lag mtshungs pa ni sngar mthong ba de da ltar dran pa yin te yan lag dang ldan pa can gyi 'dra ba gzhan yin no //üîΩmtshungs pa'i tha snyad kyi yul can gyi shes pa rnams la 'dra ba nyid de /
analyzed: yan lag mtshungs pa ni sngar mthong ba de da ltar dran pa yin te yan lag dang ldan pa can gyi 'dra ba gzhan yin no // mtshungs pa'i tha snyad kyi yul can gyi shes pa rnams la 'dra ba nyid de /
translated: The similarity of parts is the recollection of what was previously seen; it is the similarity of that which possesses parts.üîΩThe cognition that has similarity as its object is the cognition of similarity.

original: blo mtshungs par rtogs pa'i phyir blo yang mtshungs pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: blo mtshungs par rtogs pa'i phyir blo yang mtshungs pa nyid yin la /
translated: The cognition is the same because it understands the similarity.

original: rtogs pa mtshungs pa'i phyir rtogs pa tha dad pa med par bag chags thog ma med pa'i stobs kyis bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa mtshungs pa'i phyir rtogs pa tha dad pa med par bag chags thog ma med pa'i stobs kyis bskyed pa yin no //
translated: because of the similarity of the understanding, there is no difference in the understanding, and it is produced by the force of beginningless predispositions.

original: de bas na sgra sbyor ba dang rigs sbyor ba ni rtags kho na las yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na sgra sbyor ba dang rigs sbyor ba ni rtags kho na las yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the application of a word and the application of a reason are only from a sign.

original: dbang po las skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po las skye ba ma yin no //
translated: They are not produced from a sense faculty.

original: rtags ni de dang 'dra ba'i rang bzhin mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: rtags ni de dang 'dra ba'i rang bzhin mthong ba yin no //
translated: A sign is the seeing of a nature that is similar to that.

original: 'o na te dbang po'i stobs las skyes pa'i sbyor ba mngon sum nyid du brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na te dbang po'i stobs las skyes pa'i sbyor ba mngon sum nyid du brjod do zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that the application that is produced from the force of a sense faculty is direct perception,

original: de lta na ni rjes su dpag pa thams cad dbang po las skyes pa yin pa'i phyir mngon sum nyid du 'gyur te /üîΩril me yod do zhes ri dang me sbyor ba ni dbang po'i byed pa med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na ni rjes su dpag pa thams cad dbang po las skyes pa yin pa'i phyir mngon sum nyid du 'gyur te / ril me yod do zhes ri dang me sbyor ba ni dbang po'i byed pa med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: then because all inferences are produced from a sense faculty, they would become direct perception.

original: mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The application of a mountain and fire, ‚Äúthere is fire on the mountain,‚Äù would become direct perception because it does not occur without the activity of a sense faculty.

original: 'on te me la ni rjes su dpog pa yin gyi me dang sbyor ba ni mngon sum nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te me la ni rjes su dpog pa yin gyi me dang sbyor ba ni mngon sum nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that the inference is of fire, but the application of fire is direct perception,

original: 'o na sa phyogs ni mngon sum yin la mer rtog pa ni rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes bya bar yang brjod par nus pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na sa phyogs ni mngon sum yin la mer rtog pa ni rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes bya bar yang brjod par nus pa ma yin nam /
translated: But can it not be said that the place is directly perceived and the fire is inferred?

original: me la ni mthong ba yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: me la ni mthong ba yod pa ma yin la /
translated: There is no seeing of fire,

original: ma mthong ba yang sbyor ba ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ma mthong ba yang sbyor ba ni mi rung ngo //
translated: and it is not possible to apply what is not seen.

original: de bas na rjes su dpag pas nye bar @80b blang bar bya ba nyid sbyor ba de rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na rjes su dpag pas nye bar @80b blang bar bya ba nyid sbyor ba de rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the application is understood to be the object of inference,

original: mngon sum ni sbyor ba dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ni sbyor ba dang bral ba yin no //
translated: and direct perception is free from application.

original: 'on te dran pas drangs pa'i ming la sogs pa lkog tu gyur pa la yang mngon sum 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te dran pas drangs pa'i ming la sogs pa lkog tu gyur pa la yang mngon sum 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: But if direct perception engages even with the hidden name, etc., which is drawn by memory,

original: mngon sum gyis sbyor bar byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis sbyor bar byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: then direct perception would apply.

original: 'dir smras pa //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa //
translated: Here it is said:

original: de dag 'dus pas de skyed phyir //
analyzed: de dag 'dus pas de skyed phyir //
translated: Because it is produced by the assembly of those,

original: dran las dbang po'i blor 'gyur ba'am //
analyzed: dran las dbang po'i blor 'gyur ba'am //
translated: either the sense cognition arises from memory,

original: min te de las dus gzhan 'gyur //
analyzed: min te de las dus gzhan 'gyur //
translated: or it would be different at a different time,

original: la lar rnam g-yeng srid phyir ro //
analyzed: la lar rnam g-yeng srid phyir ro //
translated: because distraction is possible in some cases.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: dran pa de dag 'dus pa las te nye bar gyur pa las dbang po'i blo de skyed pa'i rgya'i phyir /
analyzed: dran pa de dag 'dus pa las te nye bar gyur pa las dbang po'i blo de skyed pa'i rgya'i phyir /
translated: The sense consciousness arises from the convergence of those memories, because it is the cause of the memory.

original: dran pa las dbang po'i blor 'gyur gyi don nye ba la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dran pa las dbang po'i blor 'gyur gyi don nye ba la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The sense consciousness arises from memory, not from the object that is present.

original: gal te dran par gyur pa'i ming la sogs pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dran par gyur pa'i ming la sogs pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were to engage the name, etc., that is remembered,

original: 'on te don nye bar gyur pa la rten par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te don nye bar gyur pa la rten par byed do zhe na /
translated: then it would be based on the object that is present.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: dbang po'i blo dran pa las skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i blo dran pa las skye ba ma yin te /
translated: The sense consciousness does not arise from memory,

original: don mngon du byed pa ni dran pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don mngon du byed pa ni dran pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the manifestation of the object is not memory.

original: gzhan yang dus gzhan du yang ming la sogs pa dran pa de las dbang po'i blor 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dus gzhan du yang ming la sogs pa dran pa de las dbang po'i blor 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, the sense consciousness would arise from the memory of the name, etc., at another time,

original: yul la lar rnam par g-yengs pa yang phyis de'i ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pa'i dran pa de srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul la lar rnam par g-yengs pa yang phyis de'i ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pa'i dran pa de srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible that one who is distracted to some object later remembers the form of that object.

original: de bas na dbang po'i shes pa dus gzhan du dran pa'i ngo bo nyid can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na dbang po'i shes pa dus gzhan du dran pa'i ngo bo nyid can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the sense consciousness would have the nature of memory at another time.

original: gal te yang don rtog pa med pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pas rtag tu rtog pa med pa'i shes pa skye ba'i rgyu don yin pa'i phyir rtog pa dang bral ba nyid mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang don rtog pa med pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pas rtag tu rtog pa med pa'i shes pa skye ba'i rgyu don yin pa'i phyir rtog pa dang bral ba nyid mngon sum yin no //
translated: If the object is the cause of a cognition that is without thought, then it is the cause of a cognition that is always without thought, because it is the cause of a cognition that is without thought. Therefore, the object is perception that is without thought.

original: rim gyis gnyi ga'i rgyur 'gyur na //
analyzed: rim gyis gnyi ga'i rgyur 'gyur na //
translated: If the object is the cause of both,üîΩthen it is the cause of the first, because they are not different.üîΩIf the object is the cause of both,

original: tha dad med phyir sngon nyid 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tha dad med phyir sngon nyid 'gyur // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: then it is the cause of the first, because they are not different.

original: rim gyis don ni shes pa gnyi ga'i rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: rim gyis don ni shes pa gnyi ga'i rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: If the object is the cause of both, then it is the cause of both, the cognition that is without thought and the cognition that is with thought.

original: dang po ni rtogs pa med pa shes pa skyed par byed la /
analyzed: dang po ni rtogs pa med pa shes pa skyed par byed la /
translated: First, it is the cause of the cognition that is without thought.

original: phyi nas ni rtog pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: phyi nas ni rtog pa'o zhe na /
translated: Later, it is the cause of the cognition that is with thought.

original: dran pa las snga ma'i shes pa'i dus nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa tha dad pa med pa'i don gyi rgyu las skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa las snga ma'i shes pa'i dus nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa tha dad pa med pa'i don gyi rgyu las skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The cognition that is with thought arises from the cause of the object that is not different from the time of the first cognition.

original: 'on te dran pa'i grogs can dbang po dang don gyi rtog pa skyed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dran pa'i grogs can dbang po dang don gyi rtog pa skyed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the cognition that is with thought arises from the object and the sense faculty that are assisted by memory,

original: mig gi skye mched grogs byed pa can gyis dran pa ma mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: mig gi skye mched grogs byed pa can gyis dran pa ma mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: then is it not the case that memory is not seen to assist the sense faculty?

original: dbang po rnams snga phyir ming la sos pa la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: dbang po rnams snga phyir ming la sos pa la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because the sense faculties do not engage their objects in succession.

original: dran pa'i grogs byed pa thob pa tsam gyis yul ma yin pa la mig 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dran pa'i grogs byed pa thob pa tsam gyis yul ma yin pa la mig 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: The eye does not engage its object by the mere acquisition of the assistance of memory.

original: dran pa dang nyi ma shar bar gyur kyang mig nyams par gyur pa can gyi skyes bus gzugs 'dzin @81a * //üîΩpar skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dran pa dang nyi ma shar bar gyur kyang mig nyams par gyur pa can gyi skyes bus gzugs 'dzin @81a * // par skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Even if memory and the sun have arisen, a person whose eye is damaged does not generate the apprehension of form.

original: gzugs gsal bar gyur na dran pa'i grogs byed pa med kyang mig 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs gsal bar gyur na dran pa'i grogs byed pa med kyang mig 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: Even if the form is clear, the eye engages its object without the assistance of memory.

original: dran pa med par gyur kyang gsal ba'i rang bzhin du skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa med par gyur kyang gsal ba'i rang bzhin du skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if memory is absent, the eye generates the apprehension of form because it is by nature clear.

original: 'on te mthong bas gzhag pa'i sgra'i rnam pas dran pa skyed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mthong bas gzhag pa'i sgra'i rnam pas dran pa skyed do zhe na /
translated: But if memory is generated by the aspect of the sound that is perceived,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: gal te sgra'i rnam pa gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi spyod yul can yin na dang po nyid du 'gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te sgra'i rnam pa gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi spyod yul can yin na dang po nyid du 'gyur pa yin te /
translated: If the aspect of sound is the domain of a clear nature, it would be generated at the very beginning,

original: de mthong bar tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mthong bar tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference in seeing it.

translated: If the name is the object of the cognition, then the cognition would have the aspect of the name, not the aspect of the object.üîΩIf the name is the object of the cognition, then the cognition would have the aspect of

analyzed: brda ni dran par 'dod pa dang // tha dad brdar btags med 'dzin na //
translated: Since memory is not the cause of the apprehension of the object, it is not the cause of the apprehension of the object.

analyzed: de la dran pa'i don can gang // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Since memory is not the cause of the apprehension of the object, it is not the cause of the apprehension of the object.üîΩSince memory is not the cause of the apprehension of the object, it is not the cause of the apprehension of the object.üîΩSince memory is not the cause of the apprehension of the object, it is not the cause of the apprehension of the object.üîΩSince memory is not the cause of the apprehension of the object, it is not the cause of the apprehension of the object.
