analyzed: gal te rdzas ni rigs mi mthun pa'i rgyus bskyed pa ma yin te /
translated: If you say that substance is not produced by causes of different types,

original: rigs mi mthun pa rnams kyis ma brtsams pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa rnams kyis ma brtsams pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is not created by those of different types,

original: 'phrod pa 'du ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no contact or conjunction,

original: ldan pa ni rigs mi mthun pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ldan pa ni rigs mi mthun pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: and because possession exists even in those of different types,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: gang gi phyir ldan pa ni khra bor rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ldan pa ni khra bor rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Because possession is not reasonable as variegated,

original: de yon tan nyid yin pa'i gzugs dang 'phrod pa 'du ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yon tan nyid yin pa'i gzugs dang 'phrod pa 'du ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a quality and there is no contact or conjunction with form.

original: gal te ldan pa gzugs dang ldan pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te ldan pa gzugs dang ldan pa yin na /
translated: If possession possesses form,

original: de lta na ni yon tan bzhin du /
analyzed: de lta na ni yon tan bzhin du /
translated: then, like a quality,

original: rdzas yin pa'i phyir rdzas nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdzas yin pa'i phyir rdzas nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: it would be substance because it is substance.

original: de lta na yang rigs mi mthun pas ma brtsams pa zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang rigs mi mthun pas ma brtsams pa zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' las 'das pa yin no //
translated: Even so, the statement ‚Äúit is not created by those of different types‚Äù is beyond the tenets.

original: 'on te nges par btags nas ri mo la sogs pa la ldan pa khra bo yin te /
analyzed: 'on te nges par btags nas ri mo la sogs pa la ldan pa khra bo yin te /
translated: But if you designate it as variegated color that is concomitant with the design and so on,

original: dper na sdong po'i tshogs me tog rgyas pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na sdong po'i tshogs me tog rgyas pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: then it would be like a grove of trees in full bloom.

original: btags pa tsam gyis yang rten ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: btags pa tsam gyis yang rten ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not concomitant with its basis merely through designation.

original: sngon po dang / dkar po dang / skya bsangs la sogs pa re re ba rnams la khra bo med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po dang / dkar po dang / skya bsangs la sogs pa re re ba rnams la khra bo med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because variegated color does not exist in each individual blue, white, or pale color.

original: gal te yan lag rnams re re khra bo nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te yan lag rnams re re khra bo nyid yin na /
translated: If each part is variegated color,

original: de'i tshe khra bo nyid de yis brtsams pa'i ldan pa don gcig la 'dus pa la khra bor shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe khra bo nyid de yis brtsams pa'i ldan pa don gcig la 'dus pa la khra bor shes par 'gyur te /
translated: then variegated color is the collection of those parts, and it is understood to be variegated color.

original: dper na sdong po me tog dang 'brel pa las de la grangs mang po rnams ldan par nags me tog can no zhes me tog dang ldan pa nyid du rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na sdong po me tog dang 'brel pa las de la grangs mang po rnams ldan par nags me tog can no zhes me tog dang ldan pa nyid du rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: For example, when a tree is related to flowers, it is understood to possess flowers, as in a grove in full bloom.

original: ri mo la sogs pa rnams la yan lag rnams re re la khra bo dang ldan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ri mo la sogs pa rnams la yan lag rnams re re la khra bo dang ldan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But the parts of a design and so on do not possess variegated color.

original: de dag re re ni khra bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag re re ni khra bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because each of them is not variegated.

original: de bas na khra bo dang ldan pa la khra bo gdags pa ni ma yin no //üîΩ'o na ji ltar me'i chos me nyid dang rno ba nyid kyis chos mthong ba las /
analyzed: de bas na khra bo dang ldan pa la khra bo gdags pa ni ma yin no // 'o na ji ltar me'i chos me nyid dang rno ba nyid kyis chos mthong ba las /
translated: Therefore, variegation is not predicated of that which possesses variegation.

original: skyes bu la 'dra bas 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: skyes bu la 'dra bas 'dogs pa ste /
translated: But how is it that the person is designated as similar to fire because of seeing the property of fire, namely, heat?

original: bus pa me yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bus pa me yin pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the designation of a child as fire.

original: de ltar sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa @88a * //
analyzed: de ltar sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa @88a * //
translated: Thus, the individual apprehensions of blue, yellow, etc.,

original: so sor gzung ba rnams yan lag gzhan snang ba'i tshe brtags nas sgro 'dogs par byed do //
analyzed: so sor gzung ba rnams yan lag gzhan snang ba'i tshe brtags nas sgro 'dogs par byed do //
translated: when the other parts appear, are imagined and superimpose.

original: de'i phyir khra bo rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir khra bo rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is the realization of variegation.

original: 'di la lan btab pa /
analyzed: 'di la lan btab pa /
translated: The reply to this is:

original: rim pa bzhin du gzung ba la'ang //
analyzed: rim pa bzhin du gzung ba la'ang //
translated: Even in the apprehension of the parts in sequence,

original: khra bo'i blo ni btags min pa'i //
analyzed: khra bo'i blo ni btags min pa'i //
translated: the cognition of variegation is not imagined,

original: du ma gcig gis 'dzin phyir ro//
analyzed: du ma gcig gis 'dzin phyir ro//
translated: because the many are apprehended by the one.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: mi rno ba me dang sgro 'dogs pa'i rgyu yod na /
analyzed: mi rno ba me dang sgro 'dogs pa'i rgyu yod na /
translated: if there is a cause for the superimposition of fire, which is not sharp,

original: ri mo la sogs pa ni ser po la sogs pa shes par gyur pa ji ltar sgro 'dogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ri mo la sogs pa ni ser po la sogs pa shes par gyur pa ji ltar sgro 'dogs par 'gyur te /
translated: how can a painting, etc., which has become the cognition of yellow, etc., be superimposed?

original: 'di ltar rim gyis gzung ba'i sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa rnams yod na yang de la gcig pa'i rang bzhin snang bar gyur pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar rim gyis gzung ba'i sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa rnams yod na yang de la gcig pa'i rang bzhin snang bar gyur pa /
translated: Thus, if blue, yellow, and so on, are perceived successively, then the perception of a multicolored object is not imputed.

original: khra bo'i blor 'dogs pa ma yin te rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khra bo'i blor 'dogs pa ma yin te rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no reason for that.

original: 'on te sngon po la sogs pa nye bar gyur na /
analyzed: 'on te sngon po la sogs pa nye bar gyur na /
translated: But if blue and so on are present,

original: phan tshun sgro 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phan tshun sgro 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin no zhe na /
translated: then they are the cause of the imputation of a multicolored object.

original: cig car snang ba la nye bar rigs kyi /
analyzed: cig car snang ba la nye bar rigs kyi /
translated: It is reasonable that they are present in the perception of a multicolored object,

original: rim par snang ba la nye bar gyur pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: rim par snang ba la nye bar gyur pa ci zhig yod /
translated: but what is the presence of blue and so on in the perception of a multicolored object that is successive?

original: 'on te yul gcig tu yan lag rnams mthong ba nye ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yul gcig tu yan lag rnams mthong ba nye ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But is it not the case that the parts are seen in a single object?

original: yul gcig tu snang ba snga ma dang phyi ma dag tu ji ltar khra bo nyid du snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul gcig tu snang ba snga ma dang phyi ma dag tu ji ltar khra bo nyid du snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: How can the parts appear as a multicolored object in the prior and subsequent perceptions of a single object?

original: dus phan tshun spangs pas yan lag rnams nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus phan tshun spangs pas yan lag rnams nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the parts are experienced in mutual exclusion.üîΩBut if the parts are not seen in a single object, then the parts are not present in the perception of a multicolored object.

original: 'on te dran pa la gnas pa'i gzugs snang du rung ba nyid kyis snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te dran pa la gnas pa'i gzugs snang du rung ba nyid kyis snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if the parts are seen in a single object, then the parts are present in the perception of a multicolored object.

original: tha dad par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na dran par gyur pa la snang du rung ba nyid ni rang bzhin la 'dzin par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: tha dad par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na dran par gyur pa la snang du rung ba nyid ni rang bzhin la 'dzin par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: But how could the nature of what is remembered be apprehended, since it is suitable to appear as different?

original: dran par gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid las 'das kyang /
analyzed: dran par gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid las 'das kyang /
translated: Even though the nature of what is remembered has passed,

original: dran par gyur pa la ngo bo nyid gsal bar mthong bas snang ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dran par gyur pa la ngo bo nyid gsal bar mthong bas snang ba yin no zhe na /
translated: it is seen clearly in what is remembered, so it appears.

original: 'o na ni mthong ba nyid sems kyis 'dzin gyi sgro btags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni mthong ba nyid sems kyis 'dzin gyi sgro btags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But then the mind apprehends what is seen, it does not superimpose it.

original: 'on te mthong ba nyid sgro btags pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mthong ba nyid sgro btags pa'o zhe na /
translated: But if what is seen is superimposed,

original: de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste /
translated: that is not tenable.

original: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa du ma blo gcig gis 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa du ma blo gcig gis 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because many things such as blue and yellow are apprehended by a single mind.

original: cig car du ma mthong ba yang ri mo la sogs pa la gsal bar yod de /
analyzed: cig car du ma mthong ba yang ri mo la sogs pa la gsal bar yod de /
translated: Also, the simultaneous seeing of many things is clear in a painting and so on.

original: mig 'jug pas thams cad mthong bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig 'jug pas thams cad mthong bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when the eye engages, all things appear to be seen.

original: skabs su bab pa'i nye bar bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: skabs su bab pa'i nye bar bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To summarize the present topic,

original: de'i phyir du ma'i don can gcig / grub 'gyur phyir rtog med pa'ang 'grub //
analyzed: de'i phyir du ma'i don can gcig / grub 'gyur phyir rtog med pa'ang 'grub //
translated: Therefore, in order to establish the one that has the meaning of many, the non-conceptual is also established.

original: don gcig rtog par byed pas kyang //
analyzed: don gcig rtog par byed pas kyang //
translated: And by the conceptualization of the one meaning,

original: de las gzhan pa'ang mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'ang mthong bar 'gyur //
translated: one also sees what is other than that.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gang gi phyir til la sogs pa tha dad pa rnams la cig car snang zhing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir til la sogs pa tha dad pa rnams la cig car snang zhing /
translated: Because different things such as sesame seeds are seen simultaneously,

original: phye ma leb khra bo @88b la sogs pa'i gzugs sna tshogs pa'i rnam par snang ba'i phyir sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa thams cad kyi yul can gyi blo sna tshogs pa'i gzugs can gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phye ma leb khra bo @88b la sogs pa'i gzugs sna tshogs pa'i rnam par snang ba'i phyir sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa thams cad kyi yul can gyi blo sna tshogs pa'i gzugs can gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: and because of the appearance of various aspects such as the form of a multicolored butterfly, the cognition that has all the various aspects such as blue and yellow is a single cognition with a variegated form.

original: sngon po la sogs pa sna tshogs pa'i yul can yin pas rtog pa med pa'i blo grub pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa sna tshogs pa'i yul can yin pas rtog pa med pa'i blo grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the non-conceptual cognition that has various objects such as blue is established.

original: gang gi phyir //
analyzed: gang gi phyir //
translated: And because

original: khra bor snang ba na sngon po la sogs pa sna tshogs pa'i gzugs ni sngon po gcig la rtog pas kyang ser po la sogs pa gzhan yang mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: khra bor snang ba na sngon po la sogs pa sna tshogs pa'i gzugs ni sngon po gcig la rtog pas kyang ser po la sogs pa gzhan yang mthong ba yin te /
translated: When it appears as multicolored, it is a variety of forms such as blue, etc., that are seen in one blue, etc., by the conception.

original: cig car rtog pa du ma skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: cig car rtog pa du ma skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But many conceptions do not arise simultaneously.

original: 'on te khra bo'o zhes rtog pas sngon po la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad mthong ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te khra bo'o zhes rtog pas sngon po la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad mthong ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is a conception of multicolored, then all things such as blue, etc., are seen.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: nges pa med pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar khra bo zhes bya ba'i rtog pa nyid la khra bor snang ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nges pa med pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar khra bo zhes bya ba'i rtog pa nyid la khra bor snang ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because there is no certainty, it is not necessarily the case that the appearance of multicolored exists in the conception of multicolored.

original: rtog pa gcig gis kyang gzugs sna tshogs mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rtog pa gcig gis kyang gzugs sna tshogs mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Because even a single conception sees a variety of forms.

original: 'dis ni blo gcig khra bo'i rnam pa can du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni blo gcig khra bo'i rnam pa can du grub pa yin no //
translated: This proves that a single cognition has the aspect of multicolored.

original: 'dir rtsod par byed de /üîΩsna tshogs snang can don rnams la //
analyzed: 'dir rtsod par byed de / sna tshogs snang can don rnams la //
translated: Here someone objects:üîΩIf it is not logical that thingsüîΩthat appear as various

original: gal te gcig nyid mi rigs na //üîΩre zhig blo de gcig nyid la //
analyzed: gal te gcig nyid mi rigs na // re zhig blo de gcig nyid la //
translated: are one,üîΩthen how could that cognition, which is one,

original: ji ltar du ma snang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar du ma snang bar 'gyur //
translated: appear as various?

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, the opponent says:

original: gang la sna tshogs pa'i snang ba yod pa'i phye ma leb khra bo la sogs pa'i don rnams la /üîΩgal te gcig pa nyid med na ni ;
analyzed: gang la sna tshogs pa'i snang ba yod pa'i phye ma leb khra bo la sogs pa'i don rnams la / gal te gcig pa nyid med na ni ;
translated: If the variegated object, such as a multicolored butterfly, has various appearances,üîΩthen it is not a single thing.

original: 'o na khra bor snang ba'i blo de nyid gcig par ji ltar rigs te /
analyzed: 'o na khra bor snang ba'i blo de nyid gcig par ji ltar rigs te /
translated: If it is not a single thing, then how could the cognition that perceives the variegated object be a single thing?

original: ji ltar khra bo'i rnam pa can gyi blo gcig tu khas len pas na phyi rol gyi sna tshogs kyang gcig pa yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar khra bo'i rnam pa can gyi blo gcig tu khas len pas na phyi rol gyi sna tshogs kyang gcig pa yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Just as you accept that the cognition that has the aspect of the variegated object is a single thing, so the external variety would also be a single thing.

original: blo sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo nyid can yin pas /
analyzed: blo sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo nyid can yin pas /
translated: Because the cognition has the nature of a variety.

original: gal te dngos po rnams du ma'i gzugs can yin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams du ma'i gzugs can yin na /
translated: If things have the form of many,

original: de'i tshe blo la snang ba ni rang bzhin sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir blo yang sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe blo la snang ba ni rang bzhin sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir blo yang sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur na /
translated: then the appearance to cognition would have the nature of a variety of things, and therefore cognition would also have the nature of a variety of things.

original: blo tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: blo tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But cognition is not different.

original: de'i phyir khra bo'i blo'i dpe nyid kyis ma nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir khra bo'i blo'i dpe nyid kyis ma nges par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, because of the example of the cognition of the variegated object, your argument is indeterminate.

original: sna tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir de dag tu ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir de dag tu ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Because it is a variety, it is not those.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: ji lta ji ltar don bsams pa //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar don bsams pa //
translated: The more one reflects on the meaning,

original: de lta de ltar dben par 'gyur //
analyzed: de lta de ltar dben par 'gyur //
translated: the more one will be inclined to solitude.

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis gang smras pa //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis gang smras pa //
translated: Whatever is said by the wise

original: de ni dngos stobs 'ongs pa yin na //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni dngos stobs 'ongs pa yin na // zhes bya ba la /
translated: is based on the power of fact.

original: 'di'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning here is as follows:

original: blo gcig yin na ni sna tshogs pa ma yin te /üîΩrnam pa du ma can nyid kyi phyir dang / dngos po rnam pa'i mtshan @89a * //
analyzed: blo gcig yin na ni sna tshogs pa ma yin te / rnam pa du ma can nyid kyi phyir dang / dngos po rnam pa'i mtshan @89a * //
translated: If cognition is one, then it is not variegated,

original: nyid can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyid can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it has many aspects and because it has the character of the aspects of things.

original: gdon mi za bar rnam pa mang po yin na don kyang mang po nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar rnam pa mang po yin na don kyang mang po nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not one, then it must be manifold.

original: de'i phyir don so so bar nges pa'i blo rnams kyang de tsam zhig tu ci'i phyir mi 'dod la /
analyzed: de'i phyir don so so bar nges pa'i blo rnams kyang de tsam zhig tu ci'i phyir mi 'dod la /
translated: Therefore, why not accept that cognitions that ascertain individual objects are just that‚Äîcognitions that ascertain individual objects?

original: ci'i phyir khra bo'i rnam pa can gcig tu khas len par byed /
analyzed: ci'i phyir khra bo'i rnam pa can gcig tu khas len par byed /
translated: Why accept that they are one variegated cognition?

original: 'on te don re re'i blo tha dad pa na /
analyzed: 'on te don re re'i blo tha dad pa na /
translated: If the cognitions of individual objects are different,

original: ji srid rdul phra rab yod pa de srid du shes pa yang yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji srid rdul phra rab yod pa de srid du shes pa yang yod pa'i phyir /
translated: then as long as there are atoms, there will be consciousness.

original: rdul phra rab re re la yang mthong bar thal bar 'gyur ro zer na ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab re re la yang mthong bar thal bar 'gyur ro zer na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that it follows that each atom would be seen, no.

original: du mar rtogs pa med de /
analyzed: du mar rtogs pa med de /
translated: There is no cognition of multiplicity,

original: shes pa rnams phan tshun med pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyis bdag nyid rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa rnams phan tshun med pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyis bdag nyid rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because cognitions are mutually exclusive and because one cannot cognize oneself.

original: 'on te rang rig pa'i shes pa rnams la snang ba sna tshogs pa nyid du shes pa yin no zer na /
analyzed: 'on te rang rig pa'i shes pa rnams la snang ba sna tshogs pa nyid du shes pa yin no zer na /
translated: If you say that it is the various appearances that are cognized by the self-knowing cognition,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.üîΩüîΩ

original: rgyud gzhan la gnas pa'i shes pa yang sna tshogs pa nyid du snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan la gnas pa'i shes pa yang sna tshogs pa nyid du snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cognitions of other continua would also appear as various things.

original: de bas na shes pa sna tshogs pa yin no zhes rtogs pa skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na shes pa sna tshogs pa yin no zhes rtogs pa skye ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the idea that cognition is various does not arise.

original: de ni shes pa rnams gcig yin na rnam pa du ma yang ma yin te /üîΩgcig pa nyid la ji ltar rnam pa sna tshogs pa yin zhing /
analyzed: de ni shes pa rnams gcig yin na rnam pa du ma yang ma yin te / gcig pa nyid la ji ltar rnam pa sna tshogs pa yin zhing /
translated: If the cognitions are one, they cannot be various aspects.üîΩHow can they be various in one?

original: du ma yin na yang khra bo la ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: du ma yin na yang khra bo la ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If they are many, why are they not variegated?

original: de kho na nyid mthong ba'i mkhas pa rnams kyis /
analyzed: de kho na nyid mthong ba'i mkhas pa rnams kyis /
translated: The wise who see reality

original: ji lta ji lta bur gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid du /
analyzed: ji lta ji lta bur gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid du /
translated: How could it be one or many?

original: phyi rol dang nang gi bdag nyid kyi don sems pa de lta de ltar med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyi rol dang nang gi bdag nyid kyi don sems pa de lta de ltar med par 'gyur te /
translated: As one reflects on the meaning of the external and internal in terms of oneness and manyness, it becomes non-existent.

original: de ni dngos po'i stobs las 'ongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni dngos po'i stobs las 'ongs pa yin no //
translated: This is because it comes from the power of fact.

original: de skad du yang rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa yin no zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: de skad du yang rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa yin no zhes gsungs pas /
translated: Thus, it is said that consciousness is empty of the entityness of consciousness.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid du 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid du 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is tenable that all phenomena are emptiness.

original: 'on te snang bar gyur pa'i dngos po ni gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid du rtog pa dag gis bzlog par mi nus she na /
analyzed: 'on te snang bar gyur pa'i dngos po ni gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid du rtog pa dag gis bzlog par mi nus she na /
translated: But if one says that the appearance of an entity cannot be refuted by the conceptions of oneness and manyness,

original: gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid du rtog pa dag gis gzhigs par gyur kyang dngos por rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid du rtog pa dag gis gzhigs par gyur kyang dngos por rtogs pa yin te /
translated: then, even though it is destroyed by the conceptions of oneness and manyness, it is still conceived as an entity,

original: sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dag chu'i zla ba snang ba bzhin du bden pa ma yin pa 'gro ba ma lus pa la snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dag chu'i zla ba snang ba bzhin du bden pa ma yin pa 'gro ba ma lus pa la snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because, like a magical creation or a mirage, it appears to the entire world without being real.

original: chu la gnas pa'i zla ba'i gzugs brnyan la sogs pa yang mthong ba yod na /
analyzed: chu la gnas pa'i zla ba'i gzugs brnyan la sogs pa yang mthong ba yod na /
translated: Also, the reflection of the moon in water, etc. are seen.

original: ji ltar mi bden pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi bden pa yin zhe na /
translated: But how can they be unreal?

original: don byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir te yod pa ni don byed pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir te yod pa ni don byed pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are devoid of causal efficiency, for existence is characterized by causal efficiency.

original: mthong ba tsam gyis yod par shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba tsam gyis yod par shes pa ma yin te /
translated: One does not know that something exists merely by seeing it,

original: rab rib kyis bslad pa'i mig gis nam mkha'i ngos la @89b zla ba gnyis gnas par mthong yang med par nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab rib kyis bslad pa'i mig gis nam mkha'i ngos la @89b zla ba gnyis gnas par mthong yang med par nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one sees two moons in the sky when one‚Äôs vision is distorted by cataracts, but one is certain that they do not exist.

original: de lta na 'on ni shes pa thams cad med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na 'on ni shes pa thams cad med pa ma yin te /
translated: If that is so, then not all cognitions are unreal,

original: 'ga' zhig gis don byed par snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis don byed par snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: because some appear to have causal efficiency.

original: 'di ltar dngos po mthong bar gyur pa 'ga' zhig gis don byed pa yin gyi snang ba tsam gyis don bye pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po mthong bar gyur pa 'ga' zhig gis don byed pa yin gyi snang ba tsam gyis don bye pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, one knows that an entity exists because it has causal efficiency, not merely because it appears.

original: don byed pa de yang sngon po la sogs par snang ba las tha dad pa dang reg pa la sogs par snang ba ni tha mi dad pas yin te /
analyzed: don byed pa de yang sngon po la sogs par snang ba las tha dad pa dang reg pa la sogs par snang ba ni tha mi dad pas yin te /
translated: Moreover, the performance of a function is not different from the appearance of blue, etc., but the appearance of contact, etc., is not different.

original: de'i phyir gang du tha dad pa'am tha mi dad par don byed pa yod par 'thad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang du tha dad pa'am tha mi dad par don byed pa yod par 'thad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is tenable that a function is performed either as different or as non-different.

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is not tenable.

original: sngon po la sogs par snang ba med na /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs par snang ba med na /
translated: If the appearance of blue, etc., does not exist,

original: don byed par snang ba yod pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: don byed par snang ba yod pa ma yin te ;
translated: the appearance of the performance of a function does not exist,

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the intrinsic reality of blue, etc., appears.

original: 'on te gang 'dod pa de nyid don byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gang 'dod pa de nyid don byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the very object of desire performs a function,

original: de lta na yang rnam par gzhag pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang rnam par gzhag pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: in that case, there would be no establishment,

original: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig cung zad mngon par 'dod pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig cung zad mngon par 'dod pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: because some would have a slight desire.

original: gdung ba dang / klag pa dang / spro ba skye ba don byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gdung ba dang / klag pa dang / spro ba skye ba don byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the performance of a function is the generation of heat, sound, and expansion,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so,

original: gdung ba dang spro ba la sogs pa bstan par mi gnas pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: gdung ba dang spro ba la sogs pa bstan par mi gnas pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because heat, expansion, etc., are not established.

original: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig la lar cung zad gdung ba dang 'ga' zhig spro bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig la lar cung zad gdung ba dang 'ga' zhig spro bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, some are slightly tormented and some are delighted.

original: gzhan yang goms pa'i stobs kyis thams cad snang ba'i phyir dang / goms pa med na med pa'i phyir 'gro ba ma lus pa ni bden pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang goms pa'i stobs kyis thams cad snang ba'i phyir dang / goms pa med na med pa'i phyir 'gro ba ma lus pa ni bden pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, because of the power of habit, everything appears, and because without habit there is no appearance, the entire world is real.

original: gal te de lta na bag chags kyi stobs kyis bskyed pa'i 'gro bar snang ba dang ldan pa'i shes pa yod pa yin gyi mi bden pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na bag chags kyi stobs kyis bskyed pa'i 'gro bar snang ba dang ldan pa'i shes pa yod pa yin gyi mi bden pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then consciousness, which has the appearance of the world produced by the power of habit, exists and is not false.

original: ma rig pa'i mthu yis sprul pa nyid mi bden pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i mthu yis sprul pa nyid mi bden pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is not a magical creation produced by the power of nescience false?

original: mthong ba tsam gyis ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba tsam gyis ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is a conventional truth because it is a thing that delights the mind when it is not examined, just by being seen.

original: de skad du yang chos thams cad gzugs brnyan lta bu'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de skad du yang chos thams cad gzugs brnyan lta bu'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said, ‚ÄúAll things are like a reflection.‚Äù

original: gcig la sna tshogs nyid de ci //
analyzed: gcig la sna tshogs nyid de ci //
translated: How can there be diversity in one thing?

original: de'i blo la yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i blo la yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Nor does the cognition of it change.

original: gal te 'di rang don 'dod na //
analyzed: gal te 'di rang don 'dod na //
translated: If you desire your own benefit,üîΩ

original: de la kho bos ci byar yod //
analyzed: de la kho bos ci byar yod //
translated: If this is the case, then what can I do about it?

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: In response to this, it is said:

original: mig las skyes pa'i blo de gcig la yang /
analyzed: mig las skyes pa'i blo de gcig la yang /
translated: If the cognition that arises from the eye

original: gal te sna tshogs pa nyid tha dad pa med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te sna tshogs pa nyid tha dad pa med par 'gyur na /
translated: were not different from the variety,

original: ci zhig mthong bar 'dod pa ma grub pa yin /
analyzed: ci zhig mthong bar 'dod pa ma grub pa yin /
translated: then what is it that you want to see that is not established?

original: 'di'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning here is as follows.

original: gal te sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa gcig pa nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa gcig pa nyid yin na ni /
translated: If the cognition that has a variety of aspects is a single entity,

original: de lta na yang @90a * //
analyzed: de lta na yang @90a * //
translated: then in that case,

original: gsung rab la 'jug pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gsung rab la 'jug pa kho na yin te /
translated: it is only the engagement with the scriptures,

original: khams gsum pa 'di ni sems tsam mo zhes bya ba'i tshig gzhan 'ga' zhig yod do zhe na /
analyzed: khams gsum pa 'di ni sems tsam mo zhes bya ba'i tshig gzhan 'ga' zhig yod do zhe na /
translated: because there are some other words that say, ‚ÄúThis three-realm world is mind only.‚Äù

original: 'di ni bden te /
analyzed: 'di ni bden te /
translated: This is true.

original: sems tsam du lta ba yod de /
analyzed: sems tsam du lta ba yod de /
translated: There is the view that it is mind only.

original: 'on te nga gal te bdag nyid thams cad kyis stong pa nyid 'di ni /üîΩrang rig pa nyid ni don rnams yod na ni /
analyzed: 'on te nga gal te bdag nyid thams cad kyis stong pa nyid 'di ni / rang rig pa nyid ni don rnams yod na ni /
translated: But if this emptiness is empty of all things,üîΩthen self-awareness is not tenable.

original: de la kho bos ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de la kho bos ci zhig bya /
translated: If objects exist, then what can I do about it?

original: des ni 'di skad du ston pa yin te /
analyzed: des ni 'di skad du ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what he is teaching.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam gyi lta ba kha cig yod do //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam gyi lta ba kha cig yod do //
translated: Some of the views of Vij√±aptimƒÅtra are as follows.

original: 'on kyang tshad ma'i stobs kyis yongs su dag pa'i shes par 'dod pa mi rtog ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang tshad ma'i stobs kyis yongs su dag pa'i shes par 'dod pa mi rtog ste /
translated: Some of the Vij√±aptimƒÅtra philosophers assert that the cognition is pure, but they do not assert that it is nonconceptual,

original: yongs su bslad pa'i sngon po la sogs pa dang / bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su bslad pa'i sngon po la sogs pa dang / bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it appears in the aspect of the blue, etc., that is adulterated and of the pleasure, etc., that is adulterated.

original: 'o na gal te yongs su dag pa'i shes pa mi snang ba de lta na yang /
analyzed: 'o na gal te yongs su dag pa'i shes pa mi snang ba de lta na yang /
translated: Now, if the pure cognition does not appear in that way,

original: phyi rol gyi rags par snang ba snang bzhin pa'i lus can nyid shes pa yin pa'am rdul phra rab la rags pa'i rnam par snang ba yin la /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rags par snang ba snang bzhin pa'i lus can nyid shes pa yin pa'am rdul phra rab la rags pa'i rnam par snang ba yin la /
translated: then the coarse external appearance is either the body of the cognition itself that appears or the subtle particle that appears in the aspect of the coarse.

original: shes pa ni bden pa'i rnam pa can kho na yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa ni bden pa'i rnam pa can kho na yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But since the cognition is only of a true aspect,

original: ji ltar chos thams cas ston pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar chos thams cas ston pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: how can it be the appearance of all things?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: de'i phyir don dang shes pa la //
analyzed: de'i phyir don dang shes pa la //
translated: Therefore, in the object and cognition,

original: rags pa snang min de'i bdag nyid //
analyzed: rags pa snang min de'i bdag nyid //
translated: the coarse does not appear, because it is not of their nature.

original: gcig la bkag pa kho na'i phyir //
analyzed: gcig la bkag pa kho na'i phyir //
translated: Since it is only negated in one,

original: mang po la yang yod ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mang po la yang yod ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: it does not exist in the many.

original: rags pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: rags pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because it is coarse.

original: rdul phra rab kyi don nam yan lag can la rags par snang ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi don nam yan lag can la rags par snang ba ma yin zhing /
translated: The meaning of subtle particle or partless particle is not a coarse appearance.

original: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang rags par snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang rags par snang ba ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the nature of consciousness a coarse appearance.

original: 'di ltar rags pa ni phyogs cha tha dad pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir dang / phyogs tha dad pa yang phan tshun dben pa'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir gcig ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rags pa ni phyogs cha tha dad pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir dang / phyogs tha dad pa yang phan tshun dben pa'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir gcig ma yin no //
translated: In this way, because coarse things are related to different parts, and different parts are in a state of mutual separation, they are not one.

original: de'i phyir de'i bdag nyid de rags pa'i rdzas nyid dam /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i bdag nyid de rags pa'i rdzas nyid dam /
translated: Therefore, the nature of that is not the substance of coarse things.

original: rdul phra rab la rags pa yod par smra ba ni bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab la rags pa yod par smra ba ni bkag pa yin no //
translated: Or, the assertion that coarse things exist in subtle particles is refuted.

original: yang na le'u gnyis par bkag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na le'u gnyis par bkag pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, because it is refuted in chapter two,

original: rags pa rdzas gcig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rags pa rdzas gcig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: coarse things are not one substance.

original: 'on te rdul phra rab mang po la rags par snang ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on te rdul phra rab mang po la rags par snang ba yin te /
translated: But if many subtle particles appear as coarse things,

original: 'di ltar rigs mtshungs pa'i rdul phra rab mang po gzhan gyis ma chod par snang bar gyur pa rags pa nyid du brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rigs mtshungs pa'i rdul phra rab mang po gzhan gyis ma chod par snang bar gyur pa rags pa nyid du brjod do zhe na /
translated: in this way, many subtle particles of the same type that are not obstructed by other things appear as coarse things.

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: rdul phra rab mang po la yang rags pa'i bdag nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab mang po la yang rags pa'i bdag nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Even in many subtle particles, there is no coarse nature,

original: rdul phra rab so so ba la rags pa nyid med pa'i phyir dang / 'dus pa'i tha dad pa yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab so so ba la rags pa nyid med pa'i phyir dang / 'dus pa'i tha dad pa yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because each individual subtle particle is not coarse, and because there is no collection of different things.

original: gang yang bde ba'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa rags pa ma yin @90b no zhes zer ba de la smras pa /
analyzed: gang yang bde ba'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa rags pa ma yin @90b no zhes zer ba de la smras pa /
translated: You may say that the cognition that has the aspect of pleasure is not coarse. To this we reply:

original: lus las tha dad pa'i bde ba'i rnam pa can gzhan gang zhig snang bar 'gyur te /üîΩsnang bar gyur pa ni lus nyid yin pa'i phyir nang gi bde ba'i rnam pa can nam /
analyzed: lus las tha dad pa'i bde ba'i rnam pa can gzhan gang zhig snang bar 'gyur te / snang bar gyur pa ni lus nyid yin pa'i phyir nang gi bde ba'i rnam pa can nam /
translated: Apart from the body, what else could appear that has the aspect of pleasure?

original: gdung ba'i rnam pa can du snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gdung ba'i rnam pa can du snang ba'i phyir /
translated: Because what appears is the body itself, the cognition that has the aspect of internal pleasure or the aspect of pain appears.

original: rags pa'i rnam pa can las ma gtogs pa'i shes pa med de de shin tu nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rags pa'i rnam pa can las ma gtogs pa'i shes pa med de de shin tu nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Apart from the cognition that has the aspect of the coarse, there is no other cognition, because that is not experienced at all.

original: rags pa ni shes pa gcig tu rigs ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rags pa ni shes pa gcig tu rigs ba ma yin te /
translated: The coarse is not suitable as a single cognition,

original: phyogs cha tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs cha tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has different parts.

original: rags par snang ba'i rig pa ni du ma yin na yang phan tshun tha dad par snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rags par snang ba'i rig pa ni du ma yin na yang phan tshun tha dad par snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The awareness that appears as gross objects is manifold, but it does not appear as mutually distinct.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, all phenomena are emptiness.

original: 'o na gal te snang ba tsam du gnas pa can dngos po thams cad yin na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te snang ba tsam du gnas pa can dngos po thams cad yin na /
translated: Now, if all things exist as mere appearances,

original: de lta na yang /üîΩde nyid rnam par rig pa tsam gyi lta ba 'dir 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na yang / de nyid rnam par rig pa tsam gyi lta ba 'dir 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: then

original: ji ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa yin zhe na /
translated: how can all phenomena be essenceless?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: yongs su bcad pa'i snang las gzhan //
analyzed: yongs su bcad pa'i snang las gzhan //
translated: Apart from the appearance of the objectüîΩthat is determined,

original: phyi rol gyi cha ltar gnas pa //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi cha ltar gnas pa //
translated: the external object does not exist.

original: tha dad med shes tha dad du //
analyzed: tha dad med shes tha dad du //
translated: The appearance of difference

original: rab tu snang ba bslad pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rab tu snang ba bslad pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: is a mistaken appearance.

original: shes pa rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid rang gi ngo bo tsam la gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid rang gi ngo bo tsam la gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, because the nature of consciousness is reflexive awareness, it exists as mere essence.

original: tha dad par snang ba mi rung ste /
analyzed: tha dad par snang ba mi rung ste /
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that it appears as different.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid snang ba la /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid snang ba la /
translated: This is because in the appearance of its own essence,

original: gzhan snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the appearance of another does not exist.

original: des na tha dad par rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na tha dad par rig pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not cognized as different.

original: 'on te rig pa gnyis phan tshun snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te rig pa gnyis phan tshun snang ba'i phyir /
translated: But if the two cognitions are different because they mutually appear,

original: tha dad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: then they are different.

original: gal te shes pa gnyis kyis rang gi ngo bo dang gzhan gyi ngo bo gsal bar byed pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa gnyis kyis rang gi ngo bo dang gzhan gyi ngo bo gsal bar byed pa nyid yin na /
translated: If the two cognitions illuminate their own nature and the nature of another,

original: de lta na yang rang dang gzhan du snang ba'i rnam pa gnyis rang rig par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: de lta na yang rang dang gzhan du snang ba'i rnam pa gnyis rang rig par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: then in that case, are the two aspects of the appearance of self and other not reflexive awareness?

original: shes pa gcig rig pa shes pa gzhan rig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa gcig rig pa shes pa gzhan rig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: One cognition does not cognize another cognition.

original: shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid rig na gzhan rig pa bdag nyid du byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid rig na gzhan rig pa bdag nyid du byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: When the nature of cognition itself is cognized, it is not made into something that cognizes another.

original: 'on te shes pa rang rig pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa rang rig pa ma yin gyi /
translated: But if cognition is not reflexive awareness,

original: 'on kyang gzhan kho na'i rig pa po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan kho na'i rig pa po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: then because it is the cognizer of another,

original: shes pa gnyis phan tshun du tha dad par 'dzin to zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa gnyis phan tshun du tha dad par 'dzin to zhe na /
translated: the two cognitions are apprehended as mutually different.

original: de lta na ni sna tshogs yan lag dang / sna tshogs dpa' bo yongs su gcod pa bzhin shes pa gnyis kyang mthong bar mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: de lta na ni sna tshogs yan lag dang / sna tshogs dpa' bo yongs su gcod pa bzhin shes pa gnyis kyang mthong bar mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If that were so, then just as the various parts and the various heroes are ascertained, would not the two cognitions also be seen?

original: gzhan yang bdag gis 'di dag mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i shes pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag gis 'di dag mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i shes pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, the cognition ‚ÄúI see these‚Äù would not exist,

original: bdag nyid mngon sum du mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid mngon sum du mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not be manifest to itself.

original: de bas na shes pa de nyid la /
analyzed: de bas na shes pa de nyid la /
translated: Therefore, in that cognition itself,

original: rang rig pa yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: self-awareness would not exist.

original: de lta na ni mi gzhan gyi sems mi mthong bzhin du shes pa @91a * //
analyzed: de lta na ni mi gzhan gyi sems mi mthong bzhin du shes pa @91a * //
translated: If that were so, then even without seeing the mind of another person,

original: gnyis mthong ba mang par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis mthong ba mang par 'gyur ro //
translated: the seeing of two cognitions would be manifold.

original: 'on te shes pa gnyis rig par byed pa bdag yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa gnyis rig par byed pa bdag yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the self is the agent of the awareness of two cognitions,

original: 'o na bdag de yang rang rig pa nyid yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na bdag de yang rang rig pa nyid yin nam /
translated: then is that self by nature self-aware?

original: gzhan rig pa'i ngo bo nyid can yin grang na /
analyzed: gzhan rig pa'i ngo bo nyid can yin grang na /
translated: Or is it by nature aware of something other?

original: gal te bdag rang rig pa'i rang bzhin can yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te bdag rang rig pa'i rang bzhin can yin na ni /
translated: If the self is by nature self-aware,

original: de rang nyid kho na shes pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: de rang nyid kho na shes pa'i phyir ;
translated: then because it is aware of itself alone,

original: gzhan shes par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan shes par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not reasonable that it is aware of something other.

original: 'on te bdag gis mthong ba tha dad pa la 'gal ba ci yod ce na /üîΩphyogs de la yang bdag gi rang bzhin /
analyzed: 'on te bdag gis mthong ba tha dad pa la 'gal ba ci yod ce na / phyogs de la yang bdag gi rang bzhin /
translated: But if you say that there is no contradiction in the self‚Äôs being different from what it perceives,

original: gang gis bdag rig pa'i rang bzhin de nyid kyis don nam /
analyzed: gang gis bdag rig pa'i rang bzhin de nyid kyis don nam /
translated: then in that case, by what nature of the self

original: shes pa rtogs par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: shes pa rtogs par 'gyur ram /
translated: is the object or consciousness known?

original: 'on te gzhan gyi rang bzhin gyis yin /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyi rang bzhin gyis yin /
translated: Or by what other nature?

original: gal te de nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis gzhan rig pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis gzhan rig pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is known by the very same nature,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: then that is not logical,

original: bdag gi rang bzhin ni bdag gi ngo bo nyid la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gi rang bzhin ni bdag gi ngo bo nyid la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of the self is grounded in the self.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid la gnas pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa ni bdag la mngon du phyogs pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid la gnas pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa ni bdag la mngon du phyogs pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that which is grounded in the self is only manifest to the self.

original: gzhan rig par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan rig par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could it be known by another?

original: 'on te bdag la gzhan 'dzin pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i rang bzhin yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bdag la gzhan 'dzin pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i rang bzhin yod do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the self has a nature that is manifest to the apprehension of another,

original: de ltar na 'o na ni gzhan 'dzin pa'i mngon du phyogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis bdag mi rig ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na ni gzhan 'dzin pa'i mngon du phyogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis bdag mi rig ste /
translated: then in that case, the self is not known by the nature that is manifest to the apprehension of another.

original: des na mi gzhan gyi shes pa bzhin gnyis pa rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na mi gzhan gyi shes pa bzhin gnyis pa rig pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, like the consciousness of another person, it is not reflexive awareness.

original: 'on te bdag la rang rig pa la mngon du phyogs pa dang gzhan rig pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i rang bzhin gnyis yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te bdag la rang rig pa la mngon du phyogs pa dang gzhan rig pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i rang bzhin gnyis yod pa'i phyir /
translated: But if you say that the self has two natures‚Äîone that faces itself and is reflexive awareness and one that faces another and is the awareness of another‚Äî

original: gcig po de rang dang gzhan rig par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gcig po de rang dang gzhan rig par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: then that single self would be the knower of itself and of another.

original: 'o na rang dang gzhan la mngon du phyogs pa gnyis su gang gis shes pa yin /
analyzed: 'o na rang dang gzhan la mngon du phyogs pa gnyis su gang gis shes pa yin /
translated: But who knows that it faces itself and another?

original: bdag gis shes so zhe na /
analyzed: bdag gis shes so zhe na /
translated: If you say that the self knows it,

original: 'o na mngon du phyogs pa gnyis rig par byed pa'i mngon du phyogs pa gnyis pa yod par 'gyur pas thug pa med par 'gyur pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na mngon du phyogs pa gnyis rig par byed pa'i mngon du phyogs pa gnyis pa yod par 'gyur pas thug pa med par 'gyur pa ma yin nam /
translated: then since it would be necessary for there to be a second facing that knows the two facing itself and another, would there not be an infinite regress?

original: 'on te mngon du phyogs pa gnyis dang bdag ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis 'dzin pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mngon du phyogs pa gnyis dang bdag ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis 'dzin pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the two facing and the self are apprehended by their own nature,

original: de lta na ni 'di mngon sum rang rig pa yin no zhes shes pa'i bdag gzhan zhig khas blang bar bya zhing /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'di mngon sum rang rig pa yin no zhes shes pa'i bdag gzhan zhig khas blang bar bya zhing /
translated: then it would be necessary to accept that there is another self that knows ‚ÄúThis is direct perception and reflexive awareness.‚Äù

original: de yang rig pa po'i bdag gzhan dgos pa'i phyir de yang thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang rig pa po'i bdag gzhan dgos pa'i phyir de yang thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, since the self that is the knower of that would be required, it would follow that there would be an infinite regress.

original: de'i phyir shes pa dang / de rig par byed pa'i bdag med pa'i phyir tha mi dad par snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa dang / de rig par byed pa'i bdag med pa'i phyir tha mi dad par snang ba bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, because consciousness and the self that causes it to be known do not exist, they appear to be not different.

original: tha dad pa med par snang ba can de'i tha dad pa snang ba gang yin pa gzhan nang du gyur pa'i cha las gang zhig sngon po la sogs pa phyi rol na @91b gnas pa lta bur snang ba de ni bslad pa ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa med par snang ba can de'i tha dad pa snang ba gang yin pa gzhan nang du gyur pa'i cha las gang zhig sngon po la sogs pa phyi rol na @91b gnas pa lta bur snang ba de ni bslad pa ste /
translated: That which appears to be not different, the appearance of difference of that, which is an internal aspect, is polluted, since it appears as if it abides externally, like blue and so on.

original: mi nga den pa yin no //
analyzed: mi nga den pa yin no //
translated: It is not real.

original: sngon po dang / ser po tha dad par snang ba dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal tha dad par snang ba 'khrul pa'i phyir dang / des dben pa'i shes pa yang mi rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po tha dad par snang ba dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal tha dad par snang ba 'khrul pa'i phyir dang / des dben pa'i shes pa yang mi rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the appearance of difference of blue and yellow and the appearance of difference of pleasure and pain are mistaken, and because consciousness, which is devoid of that, is not realized.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rig pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rig pa yin no //
translated: It is known that all phenomena are emptiness.

original: 'o na tha dad par snang ba bslad pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na tha dad par snang ba bslad pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Well then, because the appearance of difference is polluted,

original: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa tha dad pa spong bar rigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa tha dad pa spong bar rigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not reasonable to reject the difference of blue and yellow, etc.?

original: rtogs pa tsam ni thams cad du tha mi dad pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: rtogs pa tsam ni thams cad du tha mi dad pa'o zhe na /
translated: But mere cognition is not different in all cases.üîΩIn response to that, it is said:

original: smras pa / de la gcig ni med pa na /
analyzed: smras pa / de la gcig ni med pa na /
translated: When one of the two does not exist,

original: gnyi ga'ang nyams par 'gyur pa ste //
analyzed: gnyi ga'ang nyams par 'gyur pa ste //
translated: both are lost.

original: de phyir gnyi ga stong pa nyid //
analyzed: de phyir gnyi ga stong pa nyid //
translated: Therefore, both are empty.

original: de ni de yi de nyid yin//üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni de yi de nyid yin// zhes bya ba la /
translated: That is the suchness of that.

original: de las te shes pa dang / sngon po dag gi nang nas gcig ste /
analyzed: de las te shes pa dang / sngon po dag gi nang nas gcig ste /
translated: In that regard, from among the two, cognition and blue, if one of the two,

original: snang bar gyur pa'i sngon po tha mi dad pa med na ni /
analyzed: snang bar gyur pa'i sngon po tha mi dad pa med na ni /
translated: undifferentiated appearing blue, does not exist,

original: sngon po dang shes pa gnyi ga yang med par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: sngon po dang shes pa gnyi ga yang med par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: then both blue and cognition would not exist.

original: yang na ni shes pa bzhin du sngon po yang bden par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na ni shes pa bzhin du sngon po yang bden par 'gyur ro //
translated: Alternatively, like cognition, blue would be real.

original: gnyi ga bden mod ce na /
analyzed: gnyi ga bden mod ce na /
translated: But if you say both are real,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: tha dad par rtogs pa med do zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: tha dad par rtogs pa med do zhes bstan zin to //
translated: Because it has already been explained that the realization of difference does not exist.

original: de'i phyir shes pa de'i tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa gnyis kyis stong pa de ni de kho na nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa de'i tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa gnyis kyis stong pa de ni de kho na nyid de /
translated: Therefore, the emptiness of both the difference and non-difference of that cognition is its suchness.

original: des na dngos po thams cad kyi de kho na nyid ni stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na dngos po thams cad kyi de kho na nyid ni stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reality of all things is emptiness.

original: da ni dbu ma'i lugs kyi stong pa nyid kyi don bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dbu ma'i lugs kyi stong pa nyid kyi don bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to summarize the meaning of emptiness in the Madhyamaka system, it is said:

original: dngos rnams tha dad gnas pa 'di //
analyzed: dngos rnams tha dad gnas pa 'di //
translated: This distinction of things

original: de tha dad brten ngang tshul can //
analyzed: de tha dad brten ngang tshul can //
translated: is based on the distinction of those.

original: de ni bslad pa nyid yin na //üîΩtha dad de dag kyang bslad 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni bslad pa nyid yin na // tha dad de dag kyang bslad 'gyur //
translated: If that is itself erroneous,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: then those distinctions are also erroneous.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams dang 'brel pa can gyi tha dad par rtogs pa 'di ni shes pa de dag tha dad pa la brten pa ngang tshul can yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams dang 'brel pa can gyi tha dad par rtogs pa 'di ni shes pa de dag tha dad pa la brten pa ngang tshul can yin no //
translated: This distinction of external things that is cognized is based on the distinction of those cognitions.

original: rang rig pa'i tha dad pa de ni ji ltar bshad pa bzhin du bslad pa yin no //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i tha dad pa de ni ji ltar bshad pa bzhin du bslad pa yin no //
translated: That distinction of reflexive awareness is erroneous, as explained.

original: dngos po rnams kyi tha dad pa de dag kyang bslad pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi tha dad pa de dag kyang bslad pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those distinctions of things are also erroneous.

original: de bas na dngos po thams cad yang dag pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na dngos po thams cad yang dag pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: Therefore, all things are not real.

original: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa bzhin stong pa nyid kyi don yin gyi /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa bzhin stong pa nyid kyi don yin gyi /
translated: Like the two moons and so on, they are the meaning of emptiness.

original: rig pa thams cad rgyun chad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rig pa thams cad rgyun chad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that all awarenesses are interrupted,

original: de nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is not experienced.

original: bag chags dang 'brel pa'i phyir snang bar gyur kyang /
analyzed: bag chags dang 'brel pa'i phyir snang bar gyur kyang /
translated: Although it appears because of the connection with habitual tendencies,

original: nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du thams cad yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du thams cad yod pa ma yin no //
translated: like a sky flower, it does not exist at all.üîΩNow, in order to teach emptiness according to the Vij√±aptimƒÅtra system,

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: it is said:

original: da ni rnam par rig pa tsam gyi lugs kyi stong pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩgzung dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa las //üîΩphyi rol mtshan @92a * //
analyzed: da ni rnam par rig pa tsam gyi lugs kyi stong pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir / gzung dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa las // phyi rol mtshan @92a * //
translated: The external reality that is the characteristic

original: nyid yod pa ma yin //üîΩde la mtshan nyid stong pa'i phyir //
analyzed: nyid yod pa ma yin // de la mtshan nyid stong pa'i phyir //
translated: apart from the aspects of apprehended and apprehender does not exist.üîΩSince that is empty of characteristic,

original: rang bzhin med par rab tu bshad //üîΩces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin med par rab tu bshad // ces bya ba smos te /
translated: it is explained as being essenceless.

original: gzung bar bya bas na gzung ba yin la /
analyzed: gzung bar bya bas na gzung ba yin la /
translated: That which is to be apprehended is the apprehended.

original: bye brag tu shes pas rnam par shes pa ni 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: bye brag tu shes pas rnam par shes pa ni 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Consciousness is the apprehender because it is the specific cognition of that.

original: de dag gi rnam pa de las tha dad pa'i phyir rol gyi rang gi mtshan nyid shes pa dag pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ngo bo yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi rnam pa de las tha dad pa'i phyir rol gyi rang gi mtshan nyid shes pa dag pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ngo bo yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Apart from those aspects, the external reality that is the object of knowledge, which has the nature of the characteristic of purity, does not exist.

original: de nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not experienced.

original: de bas na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba yod pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba yod pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because of the emptiness that has the characteristic of existence, which is free from apprehended object and apprehending subject,

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: it is taught that all phenomena are without intrinsic nature.

original: da ni phyi rol pa'i lugs kyi stong pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: da ni phyi rol pa'i lugs kyi stong pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: Now, in order to teach emptiness according to the non-Buddhist systems,üîΩit is said:

original: phung po la sogs thams cad kyi //
analyzed: phung po la sogs thams cad kyi //
translated: The particular characteristics of all aggregates, etc.,

original: khyad par mtshan nyid bya ba yi //
analyzed: khyad par mtshan nyid bya ba yi //
translated: are the particularities of action.

original: khyad par can de'ang de nyid min //
analyzed: khyad par can de'ang de nyid min //
translated: Those particularities are also not that.

original: des na'ang de dag mtshan nyid bral //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: des na'ang de dag mtshan nyid bral // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, they are also devoid of characteristics.

original: rang gi yul du gzhan 'ong pa'i bgegs byed pa ni gzugs kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi yul du gzhan 'ong pa'i bgegs byed pa ni gzugs kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of form is to obstruct the coming of another into its own place.

original: bye brag tu shes pa'i phyir /üîΩrnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa bya ba'i khyad par can /
analyzed: bye brag tu shes pa'i phyir / rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa bya ba'i khyad par can /
translated: Consciousness is for the sake of discriminating.

original: phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams la sogs pa thams cad kyi bye brag gi mtshan nyid bya ba de yang /
analyzed: phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams la sogs pa thams cad kyi bye brag gi mtshan nyid bya ba de yang /
translated: The particularities of action are the particular characteristics of all aggregates, sense spheres, elements, etc.,üîΩwhich have the nature of being particularities of action.

original: de kho na nyid du med pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du med pa ste /
translated: They do not exist in reality.

original: chos thams cad byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are devoid of activity.

original: bya ba dang byed pa'i khyad par can gyi mtshan nyid des kyang de dag ste /
analyzed: bya ba dang byed pa'i khyad par can gyi mtshan nyid des kyang de dag ste /
translated: By that characteristic, which is distinguished by the distinction between action and agent,

original: dngos po thams cad mtshan nyid dang bral ba ste stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad mtshan nyid dang bral ba ste stong pa nyid do //
translated: all things are devoid of characteristic, that is, they are emptiness.

original: 'o na gal te yang dag par chos thams cad stong pa yin zhing /
analyzed: 'o na gal te yang dag par chos thams cad stong pa yin zhing /
translated: But if all phenomena are really empty,

original: bcom ldan 'das de kho na nyid mkhyen pa yin na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de kho na nyid mkhyen pa yin na /
translated: and the Lord is the knower of reality,

original: ci'i phyir / bcom ldan 'das phyi rol gyi don du gsung bar mdzad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir / bcom ldan 'das phyi rol gyi don du gsung bar mdzad ce na /
translated: why does the Lord speak of external objects?üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa / ji lta'i rang rkyen la ltos nas //üîΩma rig pas bcom bdag nyid can //
analyzed: smras pa / ji lta'i rang rkyen la ltos nas // ma rig pas bcom bdag nyid can //
translated: In dependence on the conditions of one‚Äôs own mind,üîΩthe ignorant conceive of things that do not exist.

original: rnam rig yang dag min rnam par //
analyzed: rnam rig yang dag min rnam par //
translated: Consciousness is not real.

original: rkyen 'gyur rab rib can sogs bzhin //
analyzed: rkyen 'gyur rab rib can sogs bzhin //
translated: It is like the appearance of falling hair for one with diseased vision.

original: bden pa min par snang ba kun //
analyzed: bden pa min par snang ba kun //
translated: All that appears as unreal

original: de ni de nyid rig can min //
analyzed: de ni de nyid rig can min //
translated: is not known by one who knows reality.üîΩBecause without the error of subject and object,

original: gzung dang 'dzin pa'i bslad pa dag / med par de rnams med phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pa'i bslad pa dag / med par de rnams med phyir ro //
translated: they do not exist.

original: des de nyid don btang snyoms can //
analyzed: des de nyid don btang snyoms can //
translated: He, the one who is indifferent to reality,

original: glang chen lta stangs nyid mdzad nas ;
analyzed: glang chen lta stangs nyid mdzad nas ;
translated: having made the elephant-like gaze,

original: /'jig rten blo'i ngo 'ba' zhig tu //
analyzed: /'jig rten blo'i ngo 'ba' zhig tu //
translated: in the world, only in the essence of the mind,

original: phyi rol dpyad pa rgyas par mdzad //
analyzed: phyi rol dpyad pa rgyas par mdzad //
translated: he extensively analyzed the external.

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: gang la bdag nyid kyi rkyen te rgyu gang yin pa yod pa de la ltos nas ma rig pas bslad pa'i bdag nyid can gang yin pa de dag las sngon po dang / bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gang la yod @92b pa'i rnam par rig pa de skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang la bdag nyid kyi rkyen te rgyu gang yin pa yod pa de la ltos nas ma rig pas bslad pa'i bdag nyid can gang yin pa de dag las sngon po dang / bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gang la yod @92b pa'i rnam par rig pa de skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: That which has its own condition, its cause, in dependence on that, that which has the nature of being affected by ignorance, from those, the cognition that has the aspect of blue, pleasure, and so on, that arises.

original: rab rib la sogs pas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i zla ba gnyis kyi rnam pa mthong ba'i shes pa skye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rab rib la sogs pas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i zla ba gnyis kyi rnam pa mthong ba'i shes pa skye ba bzhin no //
translated: Like the cognition that sees the aspect of a second moon that is not real due to floaters, and so on.

original: 'o na gal te phyin ci log tu snang ba yin na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te phyin ci log tu snang ba yin na /
translated: Now, if it appears in error,

original: gnod pa can gyi shes pas 'khrul pa nyid du ci ste mi shes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gnod pa can gyi shes pas 'khrul pa nyid du ci ste mi shes pa yin zhe na /
translated: why is it not known to be mistaken by a cognition that is a refutation?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gang la de kho na nyid rig pa med pa'i shes pas de'i de kho na nyid rig pa can pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la de kho na nyid rig pa med pa'i shes pas de'i de kho na nyid rig pa can pa can ma yin no //
translated: The cognition that does not cognize reality does not cognize the reality of that.

original: 'o na de kho na nyid mthong ba de'i de nyid rig pa can ma yin par shes sam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de kho na nyid mthong ba de'i de nyid rig pa can ma yin par shes sam zhe na /
translated: But is the cognition of reality not cognized by the cognition of reality?

original: de ni ma yin te /üîΩ'on kyang gzhan dag gang la bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / 'on kyang gzhan dag gang la bden pa ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: ma dag par snang ba yod pa de thams cad kyi de nyid rig pa can ma yin pas mi shes te /
analyzed: ma dag par snang ba yod pa de thams cad kyi de nyid rig pa can ma yin pas mi shes te /
translated: However, others do not cognize the reality of that which appears to them as impure, because they do not cognize the reality of all that exists.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang bas bslad pa ma gtogs par shes pa de rnams mi 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang bas bslad pa ma gtogs par shes pa de rnams mi 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because those cognitions do not occur except when contaminated by the appearance of subject and object,

original: de'i de kho na nyid shes par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i de kho na nyid shes par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: they are not able to cognize the reality of that.

original: gal te skye bo srog chags rnams 'khrul pa dang bral bar ma gyur na /
analyzed: gal te skye bo srog chags rnams 'khrul pa dang bral bar ma gyur na /
translated: If living beings were not free from error,

original: de'i de phyin ci log tu snang ba las yang dag pa ma yin par shes pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i de phyin ci log tu snang ba las yang dag pa ma yin par shes pa yin te /
translated: they would cognize the reality of that as unreal, because it would appear erroneously to them.

original: ji srid du 'jig rten thams cad phyin ci log tu snang ba can yin no //
analyzed: ji srid du 'jig rten thams cad phyin ci log tu snang ba can yin no //
translated: As long as the whole world has erroneous appearances,

original: de bas na de kho na nyid du gyur pa'i don stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can la ltos par mi byed pa'i btang snyoms can /
analyzed: de bas na de kho na nyid du gyur pa'i don stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can la ltos par mi byed pa'i btang snyoms can /
translated: Therefore, the one who is indifferent to the meaning that is reality, which has the characteristic of emptiness,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gang yin pa de dben par mthong ba can gyi mgon pos /üîΩglang po che'i gzigs stangs mdzad nas 'jig rten pa ma dag pa'i shes pa can phyin ci log gi shes pa la brten nas phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gang yin pa de dben par mthong ba can gyi mgon pos / glang po che'i gzigs stangs mdzad nas 'jig rten pa ma dag pa'i shes pa can phyin ci log gi shes pa la brten nas phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa /
translated: the protector who sees the Tathagata as being isolated,üîΩthe one who has the elephant-like gaze,üîΩanalyzes external objects such as the aggregates, elements, and sense bases,

original: phyi rol gyi don dpyad pa mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don dpyad pa mdzad pa yin no //
translated: on the basis of the mistaken consciousness of impure mundane cognition.

original: de dag gis ni 'di skad du ston pa yin te /üîΩphyi rol gyi don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gis ni 'di skad du ston pa yin te / phyi rol gyi don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: They teach the following:

original: phung po la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyi gsungs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyi gsungs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The aggregates and so on were not taught by the Buddha in order to demonstrate external objects.

original: 'on kyang gang zag gi bdag med do zhes gdams par bya ba'i phyir chos rnams bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang zag gi bdag med do zhes gdams par bya ba'i phyir chos rnams bstan pa yin no //
translated: Rather, the teachings were given in order to instruct that there is no self of persons.

original: 'on te de kho na nyid mthong ba phyi rol gyi don ji ltar ston par 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'on te de kho na nyid mthong ba phyi rol gyi don ji ltar ston par 'gyur te //
translated: But how can the one who sees reality teach the external object?

original: mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it does not appear.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩ

original: 'jig rten la grags pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten pa la yang ma rig pa goms pas phyin ci log tu snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten la grags pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten pa la yang ma rig pa goms pas phyin ci log tu snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is taught in accordance with what is familiar to the world, and because the world sees things in a distorted way due to the force of habit born of beginningless time.

original: 'o na gal te bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten pa'i snang ba yin na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten pa'i snang ba yin na /
translated: But if the Blessed One teaches in accordance with what is familiar to the world,

original: de kho na nyid mthong bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de kho na nyid mthong bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how can he see reality?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩ

original: de kho na nyid mthong ba'i tshe phyi rol gyi don du snang ba med kyang @93a * //
analyzed: de kho na nyid mthong ba'i tshe phyi rol gyi don du snang ba med kyang @93a * //
translated: because when one sees reality, the appearance of external objects does not exist.

original: tshogs bsags pa'i mthus 'khor lo 'khor ba bzhin du chos ston pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshogs bsags pa'i mthus 'khor lo 'khor ba bzhin du chos ston pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: However, the teaching of the Dharma occurs through the force of the accumulation of merit, like the turning of the wheel of a water-wheel.

original: de skad du yang shes pa stong pa nyid la brten nas ma nges pa nyid la sun phung ba yin no //
analyzed: de skad du yang shes pa stong pa nyid la brten nas ma nges pa nyid la sun phung ba yin no //
translated: Thus, it is said that the one who is based on the emptiness of consciousness is not refuted in regard to what is not ascertained.

original: da ni sna tshogs brten nas kyi lan gdab par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni sna tshogs brten nas kyi lan gdab par bya ste /
translated: Now, the reply to the diversity argument will be given.

original: sna tshogs pa'i rnam par snang ba yin yang gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i rnam par snang ba yin yang gcig pa nyid de /
translated: Although it appears in various aspects, it is one.

original: tha dad par bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir snyam bsams nas smras pa /
analyzed: tha dad par bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir snyam bsams nas smras pa /
translated: Because it cannot be shown to be different, he thinks and says:

original: shes la sngon sogs sna tshogs pa //
analyzed: shes la sngon sogs sna tshogs pa //
translated: The cognition of blue and so on is

original: shes pa'i rang bzhin gzhan brten min //
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin gzhan brten min //
translated: of the nature of cognition, not dependent on another.

original: mthong dus can min de la ni //üîΩ'byed pas don la 'jug par 'gyur //
analyzed: mthong dus can min de la ni // 'byed pas don la 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: It is not a perceiver of time,

original: zhes bya ba la /
