analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: because it is differentiated, it engages with objects.

original: sna tshogs rnam pa can gyi shes pa la sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa sgro btags pa shes pa'i rang bzhin te shes pa'i ngo bo nyid de shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa /
analyzed: sna tshogs rnam pa can gyi shes pa la sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa sgro btags pa shes pa'i rang bzhin te shes pa'i ngo bo nyid de shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa /
translated: The cognition that has various aspects is the nature of cognition, the essence of cognition, the identity of cognition, which is superimposed with the aspect of blue and so on.

original: shes pa gzhan la brten pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa gzhan la brten pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not dependent on another cognition,

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i dngos po yan gar ba mthong bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i dngos po yan gar ba mthong bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible to perceive a bare entity such as blue and so on.

original: de bas na 'byed par bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir sna tshogs par snang ba ni gcig pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'byed par bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir sna tshogs par snang ba ni gcig pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it cannot be differentiated, the various appearances are one.

original: 'o na gal te sna tshogs snang ba yang gcig nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te sna tshogs snang ba yang gcig nyid yin na /
translated: But if the various appearances are one,

original: phyi rol gyi sna tshogs pa yang gcig du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sna tshogs pa yang gcig du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then external variety would be one.

original: gal te dbye bar mi nus na gcig nyid yin mod /
analyzed: gal te dbye bar mi nus na gcig nyid yin mod /
translated: If it is not possible to divide it, then it is one.

original: 'on te shes pa sna tshogs pa can yang ji ltar gcig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa sna tshogs pa can yang ji ltar gcig tu 'gyur te /
translated: But how can a consciousness that has various aspects be one?

original: gang gi phyir khang bzangs kyi lcog dkar po mtshan mo zla ba'i 'od zer la mthong ba dang / nyin bar nyi ma'i 'od dang lhan cig mthong ba ni gcig pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khang bzangs kyi lcog dkar po mtshan mo zla ba'i 'od zer la mthong ba dang / nyin bar nyi ma'i 'od dang lhan cig mthong ba ni gcig pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Because the white wall of a house is seen at night in the light of the moon and is seen in the daytime in the light of the sun, it is not one.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: sngar mthong ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sngar mthong ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the previous one is not seen.

original: da ltar ni nyi ma'i 'od kyis gsal bar gyur pa'i khang bzangs mthong ba'i tshe sngar gyi mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar ni nyi ma'i 'od kyis gsal bar gyur pa'i khang bzangs mthong ba'i tshe sngar gyi mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When the house is seen now, illuminated by the light of the sun, the previous one is not seen.

original: 'on te khang bzangs kyi lcog ma mthong yang yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te khang bzangs kyi lcog ma mthong yang yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But if the wall of the house is not seen, does it not exist?

original: 'o na de nyid kyi shes pas gzhag pa ma yin te ma rtogs par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na de nyid kyi shes pas gzhag pa ma yin te ma rtogs par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not established by that consciousness, because it is not realized.

original: de lta na ni nyi ma la khang bzangs kyi rnam pa can dang / mtshan mo snang ba'i rnam pa ni sgron ma med kyang yod par dpyod na don nyid khas blangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni nyi ma la khang bzangs kyi rnam pa can dang / mtshan mo snang ba'i rnam pa ni sgron ma med kyang yod par dpyod na don nyid khas blangs par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then when one analyzes the form of a mansion in the sun and the form of illumination at night, even in the absence of a lamp, it would follow that one would accept the object itself,

original: don ni sngon po la sogs pa rig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don ni sngon po la sogs pa rig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object is the cognition of blue and so on.

original: 'on te sngon po'i rnam pa sngar ser po'i rnam pa dang lhan cig 'dzin la da lta ni yan gar bar snang ba'i phyir 'byed par byed pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sngon po'i rnam pa sngar ser po'i rnam pa dang lhan cig 'dzin la da lta ni yan gar bar snang ba'i phyir 'byed par byed pa yod do zhe na /
translated: But if one says that the form of blue is apprehended previously together with the form of yellow, but now it appears alone, so there is a distinction,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is illogical.

original: sngar gyi dus su ni mthong ba 'jug pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sngar gyi dus su ni mthong ba 'jug pa ma yin gyi /
translated: At the previous time, seeing does not operate.üîΩBut:

original: 'on kyang / shes @93b gang ji ltar snang gyur pa //
analyzed: 'on kyang / shes @93b gang ji ltar snang gyur pa //
translated: That which appears as it does

original: de ni de ltar nyams su myong //
analyzed: de ni de ltar nyams su myong //
translated: is experienced as it is.

original: de ltar shes par bya ba la shes pa'ang de ltar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar shes par bya ba la shes pa'ang de ltar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: In that way, the object of cognition is known in that way, and cognition also becomes that.

original: sngon po dang / ser po'i rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa dang / gzhan du sngon po'i rnam pa gcig pu dang ldan par snang bar 'gyur pa'i shes pa de de bzhin du rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa dang / gcig gi rnam pa dang ldan par nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po'i rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa dang / gzhan du sngon po'i rnam pa gcig pu dang ldan par snang bar 'gyur pa'i shes pa de de bzhin du rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa dang / gcig gi rnam pa dang ldan par nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: The cognition that appears as having two aspects, blue and yellow, or as having only one aspect, blue, is experienced as having two aspects or as having one aspect, respectively.

original: de ltar gzhan dang gzhan yin par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan dang gzhan yin par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that they are different.

original: 'dir snga phyi'i shes pa dag gcig ma yin pas tha dad par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir snga phyi'i shes pa dag gcig ma yin pas tha dad par rig par bya ste /
translated: Here, the earlier and later cognitions are not the same, so they should be understood to be different,

original: da ltar byung ba'i shes pa'i ngo bo nyid lkog tu gyur pa la 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i shes pa'i ngo bo nyid lkog tu gyur pa la 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of the present cognition is hidden and not engaged.

original: de bas na nyams su myong ba yod do zhes sngar gyi la shes pa 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na nyams su myong ba yod do zhes sngar gyi la shes pa 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the previous cognition does not engage in the existence of experience.

original: 'on te sngar gyi nyams su myong bas dran pas shes par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sngar gyi nyams su myong bas dran pas shes par byed do zhe na /
translated: But if it is argued that the previous experience is known through memory,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: dran pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because memory is not a valid cognition.

original: 'on te mthong ba las skyes pa'i dran pa tshad ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mthong ba las skyes pa'i dran pa tshad ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that memory that arises from seeing is a valid cognition,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: dran pa myong ba las skyes pa yin yang /
analyzed: dran pa myong ba las skyes pa yin yang /
translated: Although memory arises from experience,

original: gcig pa la tshad mar mi rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gcig pa la tshad mar mi rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: it is not suitable to be a valid cognition of sameness because

original: 'di ltar myong ba'i dus na dran pa med pa'i phyir /üîΩmyong ba nyid kyi rang gis nus pas bskyed pa'i dran pa mi mthong la /üîΩnyams su myong bas byas pa'i dran pa skyes pas myong ba rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar myong ba'i dus na dran pa med pa'i phyir / myong ba nyid kyi rang gis nus pas bskyed pa'i dran pa mi mthong la / nyams su myong bas byas pa'i dran pa skyes pas myong ba rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: at the time of experience, memory does not exist.üîΩTherefore memory, which is generated by the power of experience itself, does not see experience.

original: de'i tshe myong ba ma mthong ba'i phyir ro//üîΩsngar nyams su myong ba mthong ba ni dran pa don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe myong ba ma mthong ba'i phyir ro// sngar nyams su myong ba mthong ba ni dran pa don med par 'gyur te /
translated: Also, memory that arises from what is experienced does not realize experience because at that time experience is not seen.

original: mthong ba nyid de'i tshe yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i phyir tha dad par snang ba can shes pa la gnas pa'i sna tshogs pa ni gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: mthong ba nyid de'i tshe yod pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir tha dad par snang ba can shes pa la gnas pa'i sna tshogs pa ni gcig pa nyid de /
translated: If what is previously experienced is seen, memory is pointless because seeing itself exists at that time.

original: tha dad par bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad par bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore the diversity that appears to cognition, which is based on difference, is sameness because it cannot be diversified.

original: 'on te phyi rol yang tha dad par bstan par mi nus pas gcig tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te phyi rol yang tha dad par bstan par mi nus pas gcig tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if it is not possible to show that the external is different, then it must be one.

original: gang gi tshe lus can gcig gis sna tshogs mthong ba de nyid srog chags gzhan la mi mthun par snang bas phyi rol ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe lus can gcig gis sna tshogs mthong ba de nyid srog chags gzhan la mi mthun par snang bas phyi rol ma yin no //
translated: When one person sees a variety, that is not external because it appears differently to other living beings.

original: 'on te gzhan gyis gcig tu gzung ba de nyid gzhan la snang ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyis gcig tu gzung ba de nyid gzhan la snang ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if what one person apprehends is one, then it appears to another.

original: de lta mod kyi phyi rol gyi sna tshogs pa ni gsal bar tha dad par bstan par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de lta mod kyi phyi rol gyi sna tshogs pa ni gsal bar tha dad par bstan par 'gyur ro ;
translated: In that case, the variety of external objects would be shown to be a clear difference.

original: /'on te skye bo gcig la snang bar gyur pa'i sna tshogs pa gcig pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: /'on te skye bo gcig la snang bar gyur pa'i sna tshogs pa gcig pa nyid yin la /
translated: But if the variety that appears to one person is one,

original: rgyu gzhan la snang ba ni gzhan yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan la snang ba ni gzhan yin no zhe na /
translated: and the appearance to another is different,

original: 'o na ni skyes bu so so ba la nges pa'i rang rig pa mthong ba yin pa'i phyir shes pa kho na yin no /
analyzed: 'o na ni skyes bu so so ba la nges pa'i rang rig pa mthong ba yin pa'i phyir shes pa kho na yin no /
translated: then because the variety is seen to be ascertained for each individual person, it is only consciousness.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel ba /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel ba /
translated: Commentary on Valid Knowledge

original: bam po bcu @94a * //
analyzed: bam po bcu @94a * //
translated: Eleventh fascicle

original: gcig pa / de bas sems kyi rnam pa ni //
analyzed: gcig pa / de bas sems kyi rnam pa ni //
translated: Therefore, the aspects of the mind

original: sna tshogs gcig gi ngo bor 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sna tshogs gcig gi ngo bor 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The various would become one entity.

original: sems dang 'brel pa can gyi sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni gcig pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sems dang 'brel pa can gyi sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni gcig pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: In this regard, whatever various aspects are related to the mind would become one.

original: shes pa nyid spangs na ni dbyer med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa nyid spangs na ni dbyer med pa ma yin te /
translated: But if consciousness itself is rejected, they would not be inseparable.

original: de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa rang nyid sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can sna tshogs mthong ba ni gcig pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa rang nyid sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can sna tshogs mthong ba ni gcig pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, pleasure and so on, which are seen as various, having the aspect of blue and so on, are one.

original: yang na sna tshogs snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na sna tshogs snang ba ma yin te /
translated: Or else, they do not appear as various,

original: sna tshogs pa sna tshogs su 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa sna tshogs su 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the various are posited as various.

original: de la sna tshogs pa dang sna tshogs ma yin pa'i dbye ba yod pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la sna tshogs pa dang sna tshogs ma yin pa'i dbye ba yod pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In that case, they would not have the distinction of being various and not various.

original: rang rig pa nyid gcig pu gnyis su med par gnas so //
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid gcig pu gnyis su med par gnas so //
translated: Self-awareness alone would remain, nondual.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bye brag ji ltar med par 'gyur ba de ltar 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bye brag ji ltar med par 'gyur ba de ltar 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: How it is that the distinction of apprehended and apprehender does not exist will be explained.

original: 'on te khra bor snang ba bzhin du snam bu la sogs pa yang gcig pa nyid la skyon ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'on te khra bor snang ba bzhin du snam bu la sogs pa yang gcig pa nyid la skyon ci yod ce na /
translated: But if, like the variegated appearance, the cloth, etc. are also one, what is wrong with that?üîΩIn response, it is said:

original: smras pa / snam bu la sogs gzugs gcig na //
analyzed: smras pa / snam bu la sogs gzugs gcig na //
translated: If the cloth, etc. are one form,

original: de tshe bye brag med par 'gyur //
analyzed: de tshe bye brag med par 'gyur //
translated: then there would be no difference.

original: tha dad can ni bor ba na //
analyzed: tha dad can ni bor ba na //
translated: When the different is discarded,

original: tha dad med can gzhan mi mthong //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tha dad med can gzhan mi mthong // zhes bya ba la /
translated: the non-different is not seen.

original: snam bu dang phye ba leb khra bo la sogs pa'i gzugs gcig pa ma yin na ni //
analyzed: snam bu dang phye ba leb khra bo la sogs pa'i gzugs gcig pa ma yin na ni //
translated: Here, if the cloth, etc. are not one form, like the variegated cloth, etc.,

original: de'i shes pa la gnas pa'i sna tshogs su snang ba bzhin tha dad pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i shes pa la gnas pa'i sna tshogs su snang ba bzhin tha dad pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then, like the appearance of diversity in its cognition, there would be no difference.

original: tha dad par mthong ba med na ni snam bu khra bo'i gzugs shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha dad par mthong ba med na ni snam bu khra bo'i gzugs shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If the different is not seen, then the cloth would be only the essence of the cognition of variegated form,

original: shes pa'i chos dang mtshungs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i chos dang mtshungs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be the same as the cognition.

original: ji ltar shes pa mi gzhan gyis mthong zhing dus gzhan du song ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar shes pa mi gzhan gyis mthong zhing dus gzhan du song ba yang ma yin la /
translated: Just as cognition is not seen by another, nor does it go to another time,

original: gegs bya bar mi nus pa de bzhin du phyi rol gyi don la yang yin no //
analyzed: gegs bya bar mi nus pa de bzhin du phyi rol gyi don la yang yin no //
translated: In the same way, external objects are also like that.

original: de ltar na shes pa nyid rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na shes pa nyid rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because consciousness itself is the nature of reflexive awareness,

original: yan lag gi don rnams tha mi dad par snang ba na /
analyzed: yan lag gi don rnams tha mi dad par snang ba na /
translated: when the aspects appear without being different,

original: snam bu khra bo'i gzugs tha mi dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snam bu khra bo'i gzugs tha mi dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: the form of a multicolored patch would be without difference.

original: de skad du yang shes pa bzhin yan lag can tha mi dad pa'i bdag nyid yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de skad du yang shes pa bzhin yan lag can tha mi dad pa'i bdag nyid yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: In the same way, it is said that the possessor of the parts is not different from the parts.

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: yan lag gi gzugs tha dad pa can bor na gzhan yan lag can gyi ngo bo nyid tha mi dad pa mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yan lag gi gzugs tha dad pa can bor na gzhan yan lag can gyi ngo bo nyid tha mi dad pa mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: If the different forms of the parts are discarded, the possessor of the parts, which is not different from them, is not seen.

original: ma mthong bar gyur pa ni yod pa'o zhes tha dad par mi nus la /
analyzed: ma mthong bar gyur pa ni yod pa'o zhes tha dad par mi nus la /
translated: That which is not seen cannot be said to exist.

original: yan lag can med na tha mi dad pa'i yan lag thams cad pa'i yan lag can no zhes brjod par mi nus so //
analyzed: yan lag can med na tha mi dad pa'i yan lag thams cad pa'i yan lag can no zhes brjod par mi nus so //
translated: If the possessor of the parts does not exist, it cannot be said that all the parts are not different from it.

original: de'i phyir phyi rol khas blangs nas cig car du ma mthong bar 'dod par @94b bya'o ;
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi rol khas blangs nas cig car du ma mthong bar 'dod par @94b bya'o ;
translated: Therefore, accepting external objects, it must be accepted that many are not seen simultaneously.

original: /'o na gcig mthong bas cig car du ma mthong bar 'gyur te shes pa gzung bar bya ba gcig la 'jug pa na de nyid kyi tshe /üîΩgzung ba gzhan la 'jug par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: /'o na gcig mthong bas cig car du ma mthong bar 'gyur te shes pa gzung bar bya ba gcig la 'jug pa na de nyid kyi tshe / gzung ba gzhan la 'jug par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But then, when one thing is seen, many things would not be seen simultaneously, because when a cognition engages one object, it is not able to engage another object at the same time.

original: 'o na gal te tha dad par mthong ba de'i tshe cig car du ma mthong bar khas blang bar byas na thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na gal te tha dad par mthong ba de'i tshe cig car du ma mthong bar khas blang bar byas na thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: But if you accept that things are seen separately, then wouldn‚Äôt that entail that many things are not seen simultaneously?

original: don dam par rang rig pa tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: don dam par rang rig pa tsam yin gyi /
translated: In reality, there is only reflexive awareness.

original: gzhan gyis gzhan rig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gzhan rig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: There is no awareness of one thing by another.

original: gzhan yang rdul phra rab rnams shes pa la snang ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rdul phra rab rnams shes pa la snang ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, the subtle particles appear to cognition.

original: de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because a cognition that has their aspect arises.

original: 'on te yan lag can gyi rdzas med na rdul phra rab mang pos shes pa gcig skyed ce na /
analyzed: 'on te yan lag can gyi rdzas med na rdul phra rab mang pos shes pa gcig skyed ce na /
translated: But if there is no whole substance, then many subtle particles give rise to a single cognition.

original: smras pa / gal te phul byung skyed pa can //
analyzed: smras pa / gal te phul byung skyed pa can //
translated: If many things that give rise to an excellent cognition

original: mang po cig car blo yi rgyur //
analyzed: mang po cig car blo yi rgyur //
translated: are the cause of a single cognition simultaneously,

original: dbang po la sogs bzhin 'gyur na //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs bzhin 'gyur na //
translated: then they would be like the sense faculties and so on.

original: 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod //
analyzed: 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod //
translated: What contradiction is there in this?

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: In response to this, it is said:

original: ji ltar dbang po dang don dang yid la byed pa'am /
analyzed: ji ltar dbang po dang don dang yid la byed pa'am /
translated: Just as the sense faculty, object, and mental engagement,

original: bdag dang dbang po dang yid dang don phrad pa las dus du mas rnam par shes pa gcig gi rgyur nyi bar gtod pa bzhin du /
analyzed: bdag dang dbang po dang yid dang don phrad pa las dus du mas rnam par shes pa gcig gi rgyur nyi bar gtod pa bzhin du /
translated: or the self, sense faculty, mind, and object, are posited as the causes of a single consciousness through their contact,

original: phan tshun du snang du rung ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi phul du byung ba'i skye ba gang la yod pa'i rdul phra rab mang po de dag gis dus gcig tu mig gi blo gcig gi rgyur gal te 'gyur na ni 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: phan tshun du snang du rung ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi phul du byung ba'i skye ba gang la yod pa'i rdul phra rab mang po de dag gis dus gcig tu mig gi blo gcig gi rgyur gal te 'gyur na ni 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: in the same way, what contradiction is there in many atoms that are suitable to appear to one another and that possess the characteristic of a superior arising becoming the cause of a single eye consciousness at one time?

original: 'on te rdul phra rab rnams rgyu nyid du 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: 'on te rdul phra rab rnams rgyu nyid du 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: But if the atoms are the cause,

original: mthong bas brten par bya bar rdul phra rab ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthong bas brten par bya bar rdul phra rab ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: how can the atoms be the basis of what is seen?

original: rgyu ni tha dad pa'i dus can yin pa'i phyir dang / gzung ba ni 'dzin pa'i dus can yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu ni tha dad pa'i dus can yin pa'i phyir dang / gzung ba ni 'dzin pa'i dus can yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the cause has a different time and because the object is apprehended at the time of the apprehender.

original: de smras pa /
analyzed: de smras pa /
translated: In response to this, it is said:

original: rgyu yi dngos po ma gtogs par //
analyzed: rgyu yi dngos po ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from the state of being a cause,

original: gzugs ba zhes bya gzhan ci'ang med //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs ba zhes bya gzhan ci'ang med // ces bya ba la /
translated: There is no other so-called form.

original: mthong ba'i rgyu nyid las ma gtogs par gzung bar bya ba'i don gzhan ci yang yod pa ma yin no //üîΩ'o na rdul phra rab rnams mthong pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'dzin pa yin na ni /
analyzed: mthong ba'i rgyu nyid las ma gtogs par gzung bar bya ba'i don gzhan ci yang yod pa ma yin no // 'o na rdul phra rab rnams mthong pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'dzin pa yin na ni /
translated: Apart from being the cause of seeing, there is no other object that is apprehended.

original: mig la sogs pa rnams kyang mthong bar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams kyang mthong bar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the atoms are the cause of seeing, then the eyes, etc. are also apprehended,

original: mig kyang blo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mig kyang blo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the eyes, etc. are the cause of the cognition.

original: smras pa / de la gang gi rnam can blo //üîΩde yi de ni gzung bar brjod //
analyzed: smras pa / de la gang gi rnam can blo // de yi de ni gzung bar brjod //
translated: In response, it is said:üîΩThat which is the form of the cognition

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: is said to be its object.

original: de la mig la sogs pa'i rgyu rnams kyi nang nas rdul phra rab kyi rnam pa can gyi blo gang zhig gis bskyed pa'i mig gi blo de'i rgyu rdul phra rab rnams kho na gzung bar bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: de la mig la sogs pa'i rgyu rnams kyi nang nas rdul phra rab kyi rnam pa can gyi blo gang zhig gis bskyed pa'i mig gi blo de'i rgyu rdul phra rab rnams kho na gzung bar bya bar brjod do //
translated: Among the causes of the eyes, etc., the cognition that has the form of an atom is produced. The atoms that are the cause of that eye cognition are said to be the object.

original: 'o na gal te rdul phra rab rnams mi mthong bar gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na gal te rdul phra rab rnams mi mthong bar gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If the atoms are not seen,

original: de'i rnam pa can gyi blo ji ltar skyed @95a * //üîΩpa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can gyi blo ji ltar skyed @95a * // pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does a cognition that has their aspect arise?

original: de lta ma yin te /üîΩshes pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir rdul phra rab rnams kyi rnam pa can yin no zhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te / shes pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir rdul phra rab rnams kyi rnam pa can yin no zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: That is not so,üîΩbecause it is untenable that consciousness exists.

original: sngon po'i rnam pa can gyi rdul phra rab rnams ma gtogs pa shes pa la sngon po'i rnam pa 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po'i rnam pa can gyi rdul phra rab rnams ma gtogs pa shes pa la sngon po'i rnam pa 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said that it has the aspect of subtle particles because the aspect of blue does not occur in consciousness except for subtle particles that have the aspect of blue.

original: gal te yang cig car du ma snang ba ma yid na skyon 'dir 'gyur te /üîΩji ltar rang gi yan lag bcas //
analyzed: gal te yang cig car du ma snang ba ma yid na skyon 'dir 'gyur te / ji ltar rang gi yan lag bcas //
translated: If many do not appear simultaneously, this error would arise.üîΩHow is the possessor of parts

original: cig car yan lag can bzung yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smos pa la /
analyzed: cig car yan lag can bzung yin // zhes bya ba smos pa la /
translated: simultaneously apprehended with its parts?

original: gal te shes pas cig car du ma 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te shes pas cig car du ma 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is said that consciousness does not simultaneously apprehend many objects,

original: 'o na ji ltar rang gi yan lag rva la sogs pa dang lhan cig dus gcig tu gcig car yan lag can ba lang nyid gzung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rang gi yan lag rva la sogs pa dang lhan cig dus gcig tu gcig car yan lag can ba lang nyid gzung bar 'gyur /
translated: how is the possessor of parts, a cow, simultaneously apprehended with its parts, its horns and so on, at the same time?

original: 'on te dral sogs pa dang bcas pa'i yan lag can 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te dral sogs pa dang bcas pa'i yan lag can 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: If the possessor of parts is not apprehended together with its parts, such as its horns,

original: ba lang gi shes pa la dag pa'i rdzas snang ba'i phyir rol zhe na /
analyzed: ba lang gi shes pa la dag pa'i rdzas snang ba'i phyir rol zhe na /
translated: Because the substance of the cow appears as a pure object in the consciousness of the cow.

original: ma yin te /üîΩlkog shal sogs snang med par ni //
analyzed: ma yin te / lkog shal sogs snang med par ni //
translated: No, it is not so.üîΩBecause the consciousness of the cow does not arise

original: ba lang shes pa mthong ba min //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ba lang shes pa mthong ba min // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Without seeing the dewlap, etc.

original: nog dang lkog shal la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams mthong ba med par ni ba lang ngo snyam pa'i shes pa skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nog dang lkog shal la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams mthong ba med par ni ba lang ngo snyam pa'i shes pa skye ba ma yin no //
translated: Here, the consciousness that thinks ‚Äúcow‚Äù does not arise without seeing the parts, such as the dewlap, hump, and so on.

original: de'i phyir rva dang bcas pa'i ba lang gi rdzas mthong ba la yang cig car du ma 'dzin pa grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rva dang bcas pa'i ba lang gi rdzas mthong ba la yang cig car du ma 'dzin pa grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is established that even when the substance of the cow with the horn is seen, it is not apprehended all at once.üîΩIf you assert that the primary substance and its qualities

original: gal te yon tan gtso bo dag / lhan cig rtogs par 'dod na ni //
analyzed: gal te yon tan gtso bo dag / lhan cig rtogs par 'dod na ni //
translated: are apprehended all at once,

original: yan lag rdzogs can mi 'dzin cing //
analyzed: yan lag rdzogs can mi 'dzin cing //
translated: then the complete parts are not apprehended,

original: yon tan sogs ldan cig car min //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yon tan sogs ldan cig car min //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: and the qualities, etc., are not apprehended all at once.

original: 'on te yon tan te rva la sogs pa'i khyad par dang / gtso bo ste ba lang gi rdzas khyad par can dang lhan cig ba lang rva can no snyam du 'dzin par 'dod na yang rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos pos gnas pa ma yin pa de'i phyir de dag cig car
analyzed: 'on te yon tan te rva la sogs pa'i khyad par dang / gtso bo ste ba lang gi rdzas khyad par can dang lhan cig ba lang rva can no snyam du 'dzin par 'dod na yang rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos pos gnas pa ma yin pa de'i phyir de dag cig car
translated: But if you assert that the cognition apprehends the cow as possessing the special features of its horns and so on, or that it apprehends the cow as possessing the special substance of the cow, then the subtle particles do not exist as the basis of the relationship of possessor of the special feature and the special feature.

original: 'dzin pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dzin pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, they are not simultaneously apprehended.

original: de lta na 'o na ni rva la sogs pa khyad par nyid kyis gnas pa'i yan lag de nyid dang lhan cig ba lang 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni rva la sogs pa khyad par nyid kyis gnas pa'i yan lag de nyid dang lhan cig ba lang 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: If that is so, then since the cognition apprehends the cow as possessing the special features of its horns and so on,

original: yan lag rdzogs pa gang la yod pa'i ba lang gi rdzas de mi snang ba nyid du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: yan lag rdzogs pa gang la yod pa'i ba lang gi rdzas de mi snang ba nyid du 'gyur zhing /
translated: the substance of the cow that possesses the complete parts would not appear.

original: dkar po la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i ba lang yang cig car 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i ba lang yang cig car 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And the cognition of the cow that possesses the qualities of white color and so on would not be simultaneous.

original: 'on te rva la sogs pa'i yan lag dang / dkar po la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi yan lag thams cad ni 'brel ba'i phyir de'i khyad par can gyi ba lang dang lhan cig nyid cig car snang bar 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩsmras pa @95b khyad par can dang khyad par dag / brjod par 'dod pa gzhan dbang phyir //üîΩyan lag nyid du gzung ba gang //üîΩde nyid kyis de 'dzin par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'on te rva la sogs pa'i yan lag dang / dkar po la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi yan lag thams cad ni 'brel ba'i phyir de'i khyad par can gyi ba lang dang lhan cig nyid cig car snang bar 'gyur ro zhe na / smras pa @95b khyad par can dang khyad par dag / brjod par 'dod pa gzhan dbang phyir // yan lag nyid du gzung ba gang // de nyid kyis de 'dzin par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Or, if you say that all the parts of the cow, such as the horns, and all the qualities of the cow, such as its whiteness, are related to the cow, then the cow and all its parts and qualities would be perceived simultaneously.

original: khyad par can dang khyad par ni dngos po la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par can dang khyad par ni dngos po la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: We reply: The qualified and the qualifier are not in a real entity,

original: khyad par de nyid khyad par can du yang shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par de nyid khyad par can du yang shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the qualifier is also known as the qualified.üîΩThe qualified and the qualifier are not in a real entity, because the qualifier is also known as the qualified.

original: 'di ltar ba lang gi rva dang ba lang rva can zhes la lar 'ga' zhig gi khyad par yang khyad par can gyi dngos por shes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar ba lang gi rva dang ba lang rva can zhes la lar 'ga' zhig gi khyad par yang khyad par can gyi dngos por shes pa yin no //
translated: For example, in some cases the qualifier is known as the qualified entity, as in the expressions ‚Äúthe horn of the cow‚Äù and ‚Äúthe whiteness of the cow.‚Äù

original: khyad par dang khyad par can de dag brjod par 'dod pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par can de dag brjod par 'dod pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The qualified and the qualifier are the causes of the desire to express.

original: yan lag nyid du gyur pa'i khyad par gang yin pa khyad par nyid du brjod par 'dod pas gzung pa'i rdzas gang yin pa de khyad par de nyid dang lhan cig 'dzin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: yan lag nyid du gyur pa'i khyad par gang yin pa khyad par nyid du brjod par 'dod pas gzung pa'i rdzas gang yin pa de khyad par de nyid dang lhan cig 'dzin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The difference that is the nature of the parts is asserted to be the difference that is the nature of the whole. Therefore the substance that is apprehended is apprehended together with that difference.

original: khyad par thams cad cig car 'dzin pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par thams cad cig car 'dzin pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that all differences are simultaneously apprehended,

original: brjod par 'dod pa rim gyis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa rim gyis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the one who wishes to express them engages in them sequentially.üîΩMoreover:

original: gzhan yang // dngos gzhan rang tha dad med phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yang // dngos gzhan rang tha dad med phyir //
translated: Because the substance is not different from itself,

original: yon tan la sogs 'byed pa yang //
analyzed: yon tan la sogs 'byed pa yang //
translated: the distinctions of qualities and so on

original: 'dzin pa med phyir gzhan dang gzhan //
analyzed: 'dzin pa med phyir gzhan dang gzhan //
translated: are not apprehended, and the other

original: mthong ba yi yang blo gcig 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mthong ba yi yang blo gcig 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: would be the cognition of one who sees.

original: gal te cig car du ma mi 'dzin na de lta na ni ba lang gi rdzas rang nyid rta la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan las tha dad pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gal te cig car du ma mi 'dzin na de lta na ni ba lang gi rdzas rang nyid rta la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan las tha dad pa med pa ste /
translated: If many are not apprehended simultaneously, then in that case the substance of a cow is not different from itself, that is, from the other things such as a horse.

original: rang nyid ni ba lang ma yin zhing ba lang ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rang nyid ni ba lang ma yin zhing ba lang ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not a cow, and it is not not a cow.

original: ba lang nyid dang ldan na ba la zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ba lang nyid dang ldan na ba la zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: If it possessed cowness, it would be a cow.

original: de bzhin du rang nyid dkar po yang ma yin la dkar po ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang nyid dkar po yang ma yin la dkar po ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, it is not itself white, nor is it not white,

original: dkar po nyid dang ldan pas dkar po 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dkar po nyid dang ldan pas dkar po 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it becomes white due to possessing whiteness.

original: de bas na yon tan dang rigs la sogs pa tha dad par byed pa yang cig car 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ba lang dang rta la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan dang gzhan mthong pa'i skye bo'i blo rnam pa gcig pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na yon tan dang rigs la sogs pa tha dad par byed pa yang cig car 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ba lang dang rta la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan dang gzhan mthong pa'i skye bo'i blo rnam pa gcig pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since the distinctions of qualities, types, and so on are not apprehended simultaneously, the cognition of people who see different things, such as cows and horses, would have a single aspect.

original: gal te yon tan sogs tha dad //
analyzed: gal te yon tan sogs tha dad //
translated: If the apprehension of the distinctions of qualities and so on

original: 'dzin pas sna tshogs rtogs 'gyur na //üîΩblo ste de lta'ang de dag gi //
analyzed: 'dzin pas sna tshogs rtogs 'gyur na // blo ste de lta'ang de dag gi //
translated: results in the cognition of a diversity,üîΩthen even in that case,

original: 'brel ba can ni 'chol bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'brel ba can ni 'chol bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the cognition of those related things would be confused.

original: 'on te dang po rdzas gcig gi rnam pa can nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'on te dang po rdzas gcig gi rnam pa can nyid yin la /
translated: If, on the other hand, it first has the aspect of a single substance,

original: phyis ni yon tan dang rigs la sogs pa tha dad pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ba lang dang dkar po dang 'gro ba zhes bya ba rdzas sna tshogs par gtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: phyis ni yon tan dang rigs la sogs pa tha dad pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ba lang dang dkar po dang 'gro ba zhes bya ba rdzas sna tshogs par gtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Later, since it apprehends the differences of quality, type, and so on, it becomes a variety of substances called cow, white, and goes.

original: dag par mthong ba las phyis rigs dang yon tan dang bya ba tha dad pas gzhag pa'i sna tshogs pa rtogs pa @96a * //
analyzed: dag par mthong ba las phyis rigs dang yon tan dang bya ba tha dad pas gzhag pa'i sna tshogs pa rtogs pa @96a * //
translated: It is all right to posit a variety of things later, by the differences of type, quality, and action, from the initial perception of purity.

original: yin yang bla ste /
analyzed: yin yang bla ste /
translated: But even so,

original: de lta na yang dang po dag par snang bas gcig pa nyid du rdzas mthong na ba na phyis gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa de dag 'brel pa can gyi rdzas 'chol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang dang po dag par snang bas gcig pa nyid du rdzas mthong na ba na phyis gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa de dag 'brel pa can gyi rdzas 'chol bar 'gyur te /
translated: if you see a substance as one because it appears pure at first, later, since it apprehends form and so on, those forms and so on would be a confused mass of substances related to it.

original: 'di ltar gcig par gzung ba'i dngos po phyis yon tan la sogs pa du ma nyid du sbyor ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar gcig par gzung ba'i dngos po phyis yon tan la sogs pa du ma nyid du sbyor ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the thing apprehended as one is later connected to many qualities and so on.

original: khyad par du ma yang gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par du ma yang gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: And many particulars would become one.

original: de bas na du ma gcig pa nyid du mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na du ma gcig pa nyid du mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, many would be seen as one.

original: gzhan yang dus phyis gang gi khyad par can zhes khyad par 'dzin mi shes te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dus phyis gang gi khyad par can zhes khyad par 'dzin mi shes te /
translated: Moreover, later on, one would not know how to apprehend the distinction ‚Äúdistinguished by that.‚Äù

original: khyad par 'dzin pa'i dus na rdzas mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / rdzas mi 'dzin pa yang cig car du ma 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par 'dzin pa'i dus na rdzas mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / rdzas mi 'dzin pa yang cig car du ma 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at the time of apprehending the distinction, one does not apprehend the substance, and also because one does not apprehend the substance all at once.

original: de ltar yon tan dang yon tan tha dad par smra ba la /
analyzed: de ltar yon tan dang yon tan tha dad par smra ba la /
translated: Thus, in regard to the assertion that the quality and the quality-possessor are different,

original: cig car du ma 'dzin par 'gyur //
analyzed: cig car du ma 'dzin par 'gyur //
translated: one would not apprehend them all at once.üîΩHaving said that, in order to speak to the SƒÅ·πÉkhya god,

original: zhes brjod nas grangs can gyi lha ba la yang brjod par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes brjod nas grangs can gyi lha ba la yang brjod par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: sgra sogs du ma nyid yin phyir //
analyzed: sgra sogs du ma nyid yin phyir //
translated: Because sound and so on are many,

original: cig car du ma 'dzin par grub //üîΩbkod pa 'dzin pa mi rung bas //
analyzed: cig car du ma 'dzin par grub // bkod pa 'dzin pa mi rung bas //
translated: it is established that one does not apprehend many all at once.üîΩBecause it is not possible to apprehend the arrangement,

original: bkod pa can 'dzin mi 'gyur ro //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bkod pa can 'dzin mi 'gyur ro // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: one does not apprehend the arranger.

original: gzugs dang / ro dang / dri dang / reg bya dang / sgra lnga rnams dang / de tsam rnams kyi bkod pa'i khyad par te /
analyzed: gzugs dang / ro dang / dri dang / reg bya dang / sgra lnga rnams dang / de tsam rnams kyi bkod pa'i khyad par te /
translated: The five‚Äîform, taste, smell, tactility, and sound‚Äîand the distinction of the arrangement of those alone,

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad dam bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / rmongs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad dam bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / rmongs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi khyad par yin no //
translated: all things such as pots, or the distinctions of pleasure, pain, and delusion.

original: de lta bas na sgra la sogs pa rnams bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis du ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na sgra la sogs pa rnams bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis du ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since sound, etc. are multiple in the nature of pleasure, etc.,

original: sgra la sogs pa 'dzin pa na bde ba la sogs pa du ma cig car 'dzin pa grub par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa 'dzin pa na bde ba la sogs pa du ma cig car 'dzin pa grub par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: it is established that when sound, etc. are apprehended, many of pleasure, etc. are simultaneously apprehended.

original: de tsam lnga yang bum pa la sogs par snang ba la grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de tsam lnga yang bum pa la sogs par snang ba la grub pa yin no //
translated: Or, it is established that the five objects are the appearance of a pot, etc.

original: de ltar yin du chug na bde ba la sogs pa mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: de ltar yin du chug na bde ba la sogs pa mi 'dzin te /
translated: Even if that were so, pleasure, etc. are not apprehended,

original: de'i bkod pa sgra la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i bkod pa sgra la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the arrangement of sound, etc. is apprehended.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i bkod pa sgra la sogs pa 'dzin pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i bkod pa sgra la sogs pa 'dzin pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: because the apprehension of the arrangement of pleasure, etc. is not endowed with the apprehension of sound, etc.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i bkod pa rnams mi 'dzin na de mi srid de /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i bkod pa rnams mi 'dzin na de mi srid de /
translated: If the arrangement of pleasure, etc. is not apprehended, that is impossible.

original: sor mo mthong ba ma yin na khu tshur mthong ba 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sor mo mthong ba ma yin na khu tshur mthong ba 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if the fingers are not seen, the fist is not seen.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu med par sgra la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'dzin na grangs can la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu med par sgra la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'dzin na grangs can la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If the effect of sound, etc. were apprehended without the cause of pleasure, etc., the SƒÅ·πÉkhya would not exist,

original: 'bras bu 'dzin pa ni rgyu 'dzin pa med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dzin pa ni rgyu 'dzin pa med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the apprehension of the effect does not occur without the apprehension of the cause.

original: de'i phyir sgra la sogs pa yongs su gcod pa na gdon mi za bar bde ba dang sdug bsngal @96b dang rmongs par snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra la sogs pa yongs su gcod pa na gdon mi za bar bde ba dang sdug bsngal @96b dang rmongs par snang ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, when sound, etc. are ascertained, pleasure, pain, and delusion are necessarily perceived.

original: de bas na cig car du ma mthong ba grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na cig car du ma mthong ba grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the simultaneous nonperception of many is established.

original: de la yang phan tshun tha dad pa'i rdul phra rab snang bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de la yang phan tshun tha dad pa'i rdul phra rab snang bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Moreover, the mutually distinct subtle particles would be perceived,

original: khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po sbyor ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po sbyor ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because the relation of the qualified and the qualifier is not established.

original: mngon sum rtog pa med par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum rtog pa med par grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, nonconceptual perception is established.

original: 'o na gal te mngon sum rtog pa med ba yin na 'o na ji ltar chos dang chos can gyi 'brel pa mngon sum gyis 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na gal te mngon sum rtog pa med ba yin na 'o na ji ltar chos dang chos can gyi 'brel pa mngon sum gyis 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: Well, if direct perception is non-conceptual, how can it apprehend the relationship between the subject and the predicate?

original: mngon sum gyis chos la sogs pa ma bzung bar rjes su dpag pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis chos la sogs pa ma bzung bar rjes su dpag pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If direct perception does not apprehend the subject and so forth, there would be no inference.

original: 'on te rjes su dpag pas chos la sogs pa 'dzin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su dpag pas chos la sogs pa 'dzin no zhe na /
translated: But if inference apprehends the subject and so forth,

original: rjes su dpag pa de la yang chos can gzhan zhig dgos pas /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa de la yang chos can gzhan zhig dgos pas /
translated: then that inference would require another subject,

original: chos dang chos can mthas gtugs pa med pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos dang chos can mthas gtugs pa med pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: and there would be an infinite regress of subjects and predicates.

original: de bas na chos can mngon sum gyis shes par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de bas na chos can mngon sum gyis shes par bya ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, the subject is to be known by direct perception,

original: de yang chos du ma'i rten du gyur par 'dzin na /
analyzed: de yang chos du ma'i rten du gyur par 'dzin na /
translated: and if it is apprehended as the basis of many predicates,

original: ji ltar mngon sum rtogs pa med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon sum rtogs pa med pa yin zhe na /
translated: how can direct perception be non-conceptual?

original: 'dir mdo mdzad pas lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir mdo mdzad pas lan gsungs pa /
translated: Here, the author of the treatise responds:

original: chos can du ma'i tshul can de //
analyzed: chos can du ma'i tshul can de //
translated: The subject, which has the mode of being many,

original: rnam pa kun du dbang pos min //
analyzed: rnam pa kun du dbang pos min //
translated: is not apprehended in all aspects by the sense faculties.

original: rang rig bstan du med pa'i dngos //
analyzed: rang rig bstan du med pa'i dngos //
translated: The self-cognizing, inexpressible entity

original: dngos po'i shes pa'i spyod yul yin //
analyzed: dngos po'i shes pa'i spyod yul yin //
translated: is the domain of the cognition of entities.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus,

original: chos can bum pa la sogs pa tshul du ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid can ni dbang pos rnam pa thams cad du rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos can bum pa la sogs pa tshul du ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid can ni dbang pos rnam pa thams cad du rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: a pot, etc., as the subject, is not perceived in all ways by the sense faculties, because it has the nature of many modes.

original: 'on kyang rang nyid kyi ngo po nyid kyis byed pa po rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang nyid kyi ngo po nyid kyis byed pa po rigs pa yin te /
translated: However, it is reasonable that it is the agent of its own nature.

original: tshul de nyid mngon sum gyi spyod yul yin no //
analyzed: tshul de nyid mngon sum gyi spyod yul yin no //
translated: That very mode is the domain of direct perception.

original: gzugs dang ro la sogs pa'i chos can dbang po'i shes pa la snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang ro la sogs pa'i chos can dbang po'i shes pa la snang ba ma yin te /
translated: The subject, form, taste, etc., do not appear to the consciousness of the sense faculties,

original: gzugs la sogs pa phan tshun tha dad pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa phan tshun tha dad pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because form, etc., appear as mutually different.

original: tha dad pa 'dus pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa 'dus pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, a collection of differences does not exist,

original: de la gnas pa'i don gzugs la sogs pa mngon sum gyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i don gzugs la sogs pa mngon sum gyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object that abides in that is the object of direct perception.

original: 'on te bum pa la sogs pa gang zhig kho bos mthong ba de nyid la reg pa'o snyam ngo shes pa 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te bum pa la sogs pa gang zhig kho bos mthong ba de nyid la reg pa'o snyam ngo shes pa 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: However, since the thought ‚ÄúI see that very pot, etc., that I touch‚Äù arises,

original: gzugs la sogs pa gzhi gcig pa nyid can du grub par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa gzhi gcig pa nyid can du grub par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: it is established that form, etc., have a single basis.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: ngo shes pa mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ngo shes pa mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Because recognition is not direct perception.

original: 'o na gal te rang rig pa bstan du med pa'i ngo bo nyid dbang po'i shes pa'i yul yin na ni /
analyzed: 'o na gal te rang rig pa bstan du med pa'i ngo bo nyid dbang po'i shes pa'i yul yin na ni /
translated: Now, if reflexive awareness were the nature of the object of a sense consciousness,

original: ji ltar chos dang chos can tha dad par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar chos dang chos can tha dad par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how could the property and the possessor of the property be different?üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa / kun las log pa'i chos can ni /
analyzed: smras pa / kun las log pa'i chos can ni /
translated: The property possessor that is the opposite of everything

original: gang dang gang las ldog de las //
analyzed: gang dang gang las ldog de las //
translated: is different from that from which it is the opposite.

original: tha dad rtogs @97a * //üîΩpa'i tha dad can //
analyzed: tha dad rtogs @97a * // pa'i tha dad can //
translated: The cognition of differenceüîΩhas a different mode.

original: de ni du ma'i tshul can nyid //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni du ma'i tshul can nyid // ces bya ba la /
translated: That has a mode of being manifold.

original: rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa thams cad las log pa'i ba lang gi gong bu mthong na ni /
analyzed: rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa thams cad las log pa'i ba lang gi gong bu mthong na ni /
translated: With regard to that, when one sees the mass of a cow that is the opposite of everything that is of a similar type and of a dissimilar type,

original: ba lang gi rdzas ma yin pa dag dang dkar po ma yin pa gang las ldog pa'i log pa de las tha dad pa de yis gzhag pa'i rtog pa gang las yod pa du ma'i tshul can de yin no //
analyzed: ba lang gi rdzas ma yin pa dag dang dkar po ma yin pa gang las ldog pa'i log pa de las tha dad pa de yis gzhag pa'i rtog pa gang las yod pa du ma'i tshul can de yin no //
translated: the cognition that is established by that difference from the opposite of that which is not the substance of a cow and that which is not white has a mode of being manifold.

original: des ni 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des ni 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: chos can gyis byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid can gyis du ma'i tshul can du ldog pa'i byas pa'i tha dad par brtags pa ste /
analyzed: chos can gyis byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid can gyis du ma'i tshul can du ldog pa'i byas pa'i tha dad par brtags pa ste /
translated: The different aspects of the pot, such as its being produced, are imagined to be different from the pot itself.

original: 'di ltar gser gyi gdu bu mthong ba'i tshe na rigs dang / dbyibs tha dad par snang ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar gser gyi gdu bu mthong ba'i tshe na rigs dang / dbyibs tha dad par snang ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: When we see a golden bracelet, we do not perceive it as having a different type or shape.

original: 'on kyang dbyibs dang kha dog gi bdag nyid can gyis gser du snang ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir /üîΩchos can tha dad pa ni rtogs pas gzhag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang dbyibs dang kha dog gi bdag nyid can gyis gser du snang ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir / chos can tha dad pa ni rtogs pas gzhag pa nyid yin no //
translated: Nevertheless, the object is perceived as gold, which has a certain shape and color.üîΩTherefore, the pot and its different properties are posited by the conceptual mind.

original: 'on te chos dang chos can tha dad par rtogs pas gzhag pa ni mngon sum gyis gzung ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te chos dang chos can tha dad par rtogs pas gzhag pa ni mngon sum gyis gzung ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But if you say that the pot and its properties are posited by the conceptual mind because they are perceived as being different from each other,

original: mngon sum rtog pa med pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum rtog pa med pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then this means that direct perception is not nonconceptual.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: In response to this, the text says:

original: de ni ngo bo tha dad brtags //
analyzed: de ni ngo bo tha dad brtags //
translated: It is imagined to be a different entity.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i sems //üîΩsna tshogs min pa'i res 'ga' ba //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i sems // sna tshogs min pa'i res 'ga' ba //
translated: The nonconceptual mindüîΩDoes not have a variety of objects.

original: sna tshogs snang ba'i spyod yul can //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sna tshogs snang ba'i spyod yul can //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not the case that it has a variety of objects.

original: chos dang chos can gyi khyad par de ni ngo bo tha dad par brtags pas gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: chos dang chos can gyi khyad par de ni ngo bo tha dad par brtags pas gzhag pa yin te /
translated: The difference between the property and the property-possessor is posited by the examination of different natures.

original: rtog pa med pa mngon sum gyis sems res 'ga' ba sna tshogs ma yin par snang ba ni rtog pa'i shes pa'i sna tshogs snang ba ni mthong ba'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa mngon sum gyis sems res 'ga' ba sna tshogs ma yin par snang ba ni rtog pa'i shes pa'i sna tshogs snang ba ni mthong ba'i yul ma yin te /
translated: The non-conceptual direct perception, which is not a variety of the sometimes-mind, does not see the variety of appearances of conceptual consciousness.

original: mngon sum ni mngon du byed pa'i rnam pa can yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon sum ni mngon du byed pa'i rnam pa can yin gyi /
translated: Direct perception has the aspect of making manifest.

original: de rtog pas bzhag pa rnams 'dzin pa can du rig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de rtog pas bzhag pa rnams 'dzin pa can du rig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not known to apprehend what is posited by thought.

original: don dang 'brel pas kyang mngon sum res 'ga' ba nyid kyis brtags pa'i rang bzhin tha dad pa'i res 'ga' ba ni mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: don dang 'brel pas kyang mngon sum res 'ga' ba nyid kyis brtags pa'i rang bzhin tha dad pa'i res 'ga' ba ni mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: Also, because of its connection with the object, the direct perception, being sometimes-only, does not see the sometimes-only of the different natures posited by thought.

original: mngon sum ni dngos po'i rnam pa can yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum ni dngos po'i rnam pa can yin te /
translated: Direct perception has the aspect of the thing.

original: du ma'i rnam pa can gyi chos tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ma'i rnam pa can gyi chos tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a variety of aspects because of the difference of the properties.

original: de'i phyir rtog pa dang mthong ba dag ni rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir dang / rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa ni don dam pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtog pa dang mthong ba dag ni rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir dang / rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa ni don dam pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since thought and seeing have different causes and different aspects, they are different in reality.

original: 'o na dkar po la sogs pa'i chos tha dad pa rtog pa dang bral ba yang yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na dkar po la sogs pa'i chos tha dad pa rtog pa dang bral ba yang yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But aren‚Äôt there also different phenomena such as white that are free from thought?

original: mngon sum gyi yul yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi yul yin no zhe na /
translated: They are objects of direct perception.üîΩIn response, Aryadeva says:

original: smras pa / gal te'ang dkar po nyid la sogs //
analyzed: smras pa / gal te'ang dkar po nyid la sogs //
translated: Even if white and so on

original: ji ltar dbang po'i yul yin pas //üîΩshes pa'i ngo bo tha dad phyir //
analyzed: ji ltar dbang po'i yul yin pas // shes pa'i ngo bo tha dad phyir //
translated: are objects of the senses,

original: de ni sgra yi brjod bya @97b min ;üîΩ/ zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni sgra yi brjod bya @97b min ; / zhes bya ba la /
translated: they are not the referents of wordsüîΩbecause they are different aspects of consciousness.

original: gal te dkar po nyid la sogs pa dbang po'i spyod yul yin pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: gal te dkar po nyid la sogs pa dbang po'i spyod yul yin pa de lta na yang /
translated: Even if white and so on are objects of the senses,

original: ji lta bu'i dkar po gsal ba dbang po'i spyod yul yin pa'i dkar po nyid la sogs pa de ni sgra yi brjod bya ma yin te /
analyzed: ji lta bu'i dkar po gsal ba dbang po'i spyod yul yin pa'i dkar po nyid la sogs pa de ni sgra yi brjod bya ma yin te /
translated: white and so on, which are the objects of the senses in the way that white appears, are not the referents of words.

original: 'di ltar dbang pos dkar po chos can gyi tshul nas shes pa ma yin zhing ;
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang pos dkar po chos can gyi tshul nas shes pa ma yin zhing ;
translated: In this way, the senses do not know white and so on as the property of a substance.

original: dbyibs las tha dad par shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbyibs las tha dad par shes pa ma yin no //
translated: but it is not known as separate from shape.
